story:
MyHairStoreOnline.net Inc.’s (MHSO) is a part of the $1 Trillion Dollar Hair Care Industry. With the ever-changing market of the beauty industry, we are an online international beauty supply and equipment distribution center.

We have the prestigious honor of 40 years of experience in the cosmetology and barbering industry. It is our goal to be identified as the premier supply and equipment distribution sales company in the world.

Not only do we save our clients’ money on their beauty and equipment supplies, but on their shopping and travel gas; not mention the gas it takes to pick up their products from the local store. All of this is done from the comforts of your computer which makes us cheaper than the store, brought right to your door!

In addition, we have constructed an aggressive and dynamic direct sales and network marketing compensation plan for individuals to own their very own online beauty and equipment supply store as Independent Business Owners(IBO).

Our focus, energy and efforts are to grow a global market share through recruitment and development of our Independent Business Owners (IBOs).

This innovative business will change the way we buy and sell hair care products forever.

 

To get more information visit: www.myhairstoreonline.net

 

Official Launch May 11th: www.wilsonsecrettickets.com

story:
Hello, I am Cody Black. I am just a friend of the daughters in the Dobbs family.
I am putting together a large music festival to raise money for the family in light of their recent loss, and a lot of people can't make it. There are bands from all over Texas, from Oklahoma, from Florida. This is for people to support the cause without physically being there.
I lost my mother last December, as well as my best friend in November. Both to cancer, a tragic experience no one should have to go through, and a curse no family should have to bear. I noticed that the only thing that ever came close to helping me was support from friends, from family, even from people I haven't talked to in over a year. Even strangers came and showed their support at the memorial festival I put together for my mother. Support in this troubling time is one of the most appreciated and comforting things you could possibly have.

story:
IdealSeat Spring Training - 30 Stadiums, 30 Days

IdealSeat is a mobile and web-based platform that allows fans to become baseball statisticians and collect data about the game and the fan experience.

How it works: Fans download the app (available on iTunes opening day 2013), attend and track all batted balls during the game, and then all data is integrated into heatmaps on the app and our website that show you where the most action is on and off the field, so you can buy a better seat at a lower price.

Why IdealSeat: Have you ever been at a baseball game and watched as foul ball after foul ball lands in the section next to you? Or on the equivalent section on the opposite side of the stadium? Well, these occurrences are not completely random ... they actually occur due to a range of factors like if the pitcher is a righty or lefty, the speed with which the pitcher throws the ball, and the type of batter in the box.

In some cases, you can literally purchase a seat that is less expensive and have a BETTER chance to catch a foul ball. Nothing is better than coming home with a souvenir from the park, and at some stadiums game-used balls cost $35-100. Why spend all that money when you could spend less, come home with a ball, and have more money to attend more games? IdealSeat gives fans the tools to get into that better seat at a baseball game. 

How you can join the team: IdealSeat is driven by fan-collected data. We are only as good as the information we gather. We need Major League talent to download our app (available on iTunes in March), and attend and track games. We’re ready to move beyond Seattle and take the Major League world by storm. When you contribute to the Indiegogo campaign, you help to get us to our first 10 stadiums so we can collect more data and make games better for fans in other cities. Contribute today and help us decide which stadiums to go to next with your votes in the comment section!

The perks: Join a small group of dedicated baseball nuts creating new technology tools for fans. Compete for a chance to have lunch with Major Leaguer Sam Fuld this summer. Receive discounts on tickets. Get one-of-a-kind IdealSeat gear. Check us out on our blog, Facebook, and Twitter.

IdealSeat History: In Summer 2011, a small group of fans started playing with the concept of our IdealSeat, which we determined as sitting in the sun, drinking a cold beverage and, catch the elusive foul ball. This is also known to many as the Ferris Bueller moment at Wrigley Field – one of the best baseball scenes in any movie.

To achieve Ferris Bueller status, we figured all we needed to do was collect some simple stats that would of course be readily available and create a very simple model that would put us directly into the IdealSeat. Looking back now, I think we all wish it were that simple!

See, it turns out that much of this information is simply not available to the mainstream consumer on MLB, ESPN, Ticketmaster or StubHub, Seatgeek or Fangraphs for that matter. So we needed to do the best thing – create the database.

Starting in September 2011 a small group of us started tracking foul ball locations at Safeco Field…on paper. This turned out to be unbelievably tedious and the simple act of tracking foul balls took hours upon hours for a low quality product. We soon realized that using technology to our advantage would be key and in 2012 we create a mobile app for iPhones and iPads that would allow for collection and analysis in a much more streamlined fashion.

Over the course of 2012, our core team of 9 IdealSeat founders and our research team collected data at nearly every game on foul and fair ball locations. The end result – a robust database of 3,712 data points with all of the information you would ever want on where the action really happens at games.

Where’s your IdealSeat? Where do you want to be sitting when the ball flies off the bat? How can we make the technology collect the info you need to know?

IdealSeat – All About the Baseball Fan

story:
Everyone has the power to help. We make it simple.

During difficult economic times, charities and causes find it extremely challenging to raise the money needed to continue their good work. We wanted to find a simple way for all of us to help and so we have developed www.SimpleToGive.com.

Who We Are

SimpleToGive.com shares 50% - 80% of commission revenue earned with charities and causes.

Online shoppers are simply asked to change their online buying habits by buying through  www.SimpleToGive.com.  50% - 80% of the commission revenue generated by these purchase go to selected charities or causes. Shoppers pay no extra money for their goods and services.

The charity that we have supported to date is Project HANDS .  So far, we have been able to generate funds to support two life changing surgeries. 

www.projecthands.org

As co-founders of this company, we have received no compensation and have contributed our time and money for the past two years to develop www.SimpleToGive.com. We are motivated simply by our desire to help those less fortunate. Our financial statements are audited and we are transparent in all we do.

Ute Philips and Andreas Schleich, Co-Founders

Our Project

We are currently developing an online software plug-in that links supporters of a cause and the online merchant from whom they are buying to make it even “simpler to give”. We believe that this plug-in will allow us to generate very significant funds for charities and causes that wish to increase their revenues with little or no cost to their organization.

Why what we do matters

Here is a simple projection of what just 500 supporters can fund in one (1) year by buying online through our website, www.SimpleToGive.com .

 

 

You can see the impact that just 500 supporters can have.

Imagine what  50,000 supporters could fund

– and remember, no one is donating any money or paying extra for the goods and services they buy online when they shop thru www.SimpleTogive.com .

  All funds come from a sharing of revenue commission paid by online merchants when you buy online through www.SimpleToGive.com .

 

We currently have 2,916 Twitter followers and 2,954 likes on our Facebook page.

We are asking for $20,000 for software development costs.

 Please contribute to our campaign.

You can help change a life.

story:
Short Summary

our website: www.thefamilyfishfarmsnetwork.com

I want to build a chain of employee owned urban aquaponic micro farms in the inner cities of America. Provide fresh, clean food, eliminate farm source pollution, cut the carbon footprint of food,save millions of gallons of fresh water, and create 10,000 decent paying jobs for the worker owners! YOU ... can help me do this!

You saw the video. I won't bore you with my details except to say, I'm an Organizational Psychologist with 30 years of experience and the best team in the world ready to jump in and make this happen.

We are NOT building big farms. We are building lots of small ones. Our is a distributive food growing model. All our food is LOCAL FOOD! because all our food is grown locally.

Aquaponics

This is a 500 year old technology. We are bringing it into the 21st century. It's really simple. We grow fish in tanks ... the fish effluent is filtered and bio digested, then passed through the vegetable growing filed ... the plants filter out what they need, then we refilter and it flows back into the fish. It is a recirculating system and unlike traditional soil farming, we don't cause pollution, we remove it!

 

Creating a NEW way to grow and distribute food

This is American innovation ... Grow 12 months a year right in the inner cities, and cut out the costly transportation. Eliminate the long supply lines from Chile, Mexico, and California. It makes no sense to grow lettuce in CA and ship it to DC -- the average head of lettuce travels 1,500 miles from harvest to table. The suits don't want to take a chance on us, even though we have the technology (two patents coming) and the ability. We need to build one first ... and it ain't cheap!

Your confidence in us makes all this possible!  The investors will come in droves once they see how this will work. This is why we've come to you! DIRECTLY! We are breaking a paradigm here! Many say it ... but WE are actually doing it! We are taking the risk, building a "proof-of-concept," a prototype, and we need the funds to finish it.

Together, we can change the way food is grown and distributed. Here in America 25 million of us live in food deserts. We can change all that. New jobs, Fresh Clean Food 12 months a year, Millions of Gallons of Clean Water, Elimination of Tons of Pollutants, and 10K New Jobs!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $75,000 to build our first unit and to secure our patents. This will provide bridge funds. We have our law firm, Foley Lardner, taking us through two rounds of private equity subsequent to this crowd funding effort. We want you to be with us as we grow this business. It is our intention to complete both rounds of private equity and then seek funding through an IPO.

In for a penny, in for a pound. Join us now and be with us in the end!

What Can We Do for You?

First, we will place a bronze plaque next to the front door of every one of the 400 micro farms we will build with the name of everyone who contributes to us in this campaign. If we do NOT reach our full objective, we will use those funds to start and to raise additional money from socially responsible investors. We will still honor our agreement for the plaque! Everyone, no matter how small the contribution, will be honored. 

note: Food Discounts will be available only where we have operating aquaponic micro farms.

  • Each person who contributes will get a discount card that will enroll you in The Heathy Food Alliance.  This card will also give you a guaranteed discount on all food we grow for the period of one year.  A healthy dividend for sure.
  • A newsletter every month that will show where our first units will be deployed, what jobs are available and what progress we are making.  Also, access to our website to check construction CAMs and chat with management.

 

... and another important point!

Our Veterans have paid a hard price for us. Young Vets have a 29% unemployment rate. That's just not right! I'm a Veteran. I will make this a 100% Veteran's hiring preference. It will not end the problem, but it will for some. Join us and help give them a chance. Vets make good employees. They're mission and objective driven and they are team players. Help us to HIRE Them!

 

The Impact

Our Blog: www.familyfishfarms.blogspot.com

At the very least we end farm pollution, save water, and create good jobs, but there's more ... NO CARDBOARD TOMATOES! We will provide reasonably priced local food where and when it's needed (grow here, eat here) 12 months a year. Sandwhiches and salads will taste good again, even in the middle of the winter. We could also save your life and that of your family. When there is another crisis, our food supply is at risk because of the long vulnerable supply lines. Once the supermarket shelves and bins are empty there is NO MORE FOOD.

A family Fish Farm in your neighborhood is a national security issue. It is, in fact, Food Security!

Other Ways You Can Help

-- Like us here on Indiegogo! It adds to everyone's confidence in us.

-- Post this link on all of your social media and ask your network to support us.

-- Go to our Facebook Page:https://www.facebook.com/pages/Family-Fish-Farm... and LIKE us.

story:
Who we are:

Howdy and Namaste!

We are The Little Yoga House, a yoga destination just for kids! Located in Austin, Texas, our magical studio/school has a unique yoga curriculum designed to teach toddlers, kids and teens alike the value of having a healthy body, mind and spirit.  We offer a variety of programs from prenatal classes to cool teen workshops – we have something for everyone!

We are organizing fundraisers for our community outreach programs and our Yoga Peace School.  Our community outreach programs will help make yoga accessible to all children. We will offer community classes throughout the week at our studio at a discounted rate and donation-based yoga and art classes that will run multiple times a month, both at our studio and off-site.  All class donations will be put towards a different local children`s charity each month. 

The Yoga Peace School will be the first yoga school in Austin for kids ages 3-5.  What in the world is yoga school? Our YPS program will provide preschoolers the foundation of a fun yoga practice and the freedom to express themselves creatively through art, dance, theater and music. With an emphasis on social and emotional development, each child will build strength and confidence through partner work and individual activities.  In addition, environmental and cultural awareness is a large component of our curriculum as we take a “journey” around the world. Each week the children will have an art project related to the curriculum and we will use mostly recycled materials to create mindful masterpieces. Our belief of quality over quantity is reflected in our class size, as they are small to give individualized attention to each student.  The aim of the program is to implement healthy holistic habits in a safe, comfortable space filled with hours of pure peaceful fun!

How will your donation help?

The funds we raise will help us:

  • Reach a larger, more diverse student body 
  • Provide scholarships for the Yoga Peace School
  • Staff our community classes with the best teachers
  • Build our Yoga Peace School community garden
  • Further develop our programs

Other ways you can help:

We understand that times are tough and you may not be able to donate today...no worries! There are many other ways you can help us out.

  • If you are in the Austin area, come by the studio and lend us a hand. We have lot`s to do to get the space ready for our grand opening. 
  • Spread the LOVE! Tell your friends about us! Post our campaign on facebook and twitter!
  • Send us your ideas, questions, concerns...let us know how we can make our business the best it can be!

Our Goal

Our goal here is to not only raise funds to make these programs possible, but also to introduce you to the wonderful world of yoga for kids. We will post fun poses and games online (www.thelittleyogahouse.com) that you can practice with your kids or your friends, we will share healthy kid-approved recipes and other fun activities for the whole family to enjoy. 

The Story of Abby & An: 

It was a brisk February evening
While the children were dreaming
Two yogis met

It was an evening they will never forget.
Rainbow Kids Training ignited a spark
On a children’s yoga journey they would embark.

Both playful and petite
It was fate they should meet
Two bold southern girls
Set out on a mission with their hearts’ intuition
To bring laughter and fun to the yogic tradition.

An trained in Bali, Spain, and Hawaii
Abby studied in Italy and New York City
They met back in Austin with lots of yoga to share
Their hearts filled with peace and love and oh so aware.
From prenatal to babies and children to teens
These two little ladies were training machines.

The Little Yoga House was born in 2010
A labor of love, compassion, and zen
The union of yoga, children, and the arts
Brings joy to their days and love to their hearts.

 

We want to thank you all ahead of time for your support and for believing in us and our mission!  

Peace, Love & Gratitude, 

Abby & An

We will post fun poses and games online (www.thelittleyogahouse.com) that you can practice with your kids or your friends, we will share healthy kid-approved recipes and other fun activities for the whole family to enjoy. 
The Story of Abby & An: 
It was a brisk February eveningWhile the children were dreamingTwo yogis met
It was an evening they will never forget.Rainbow Kids Training ignited a sparkOn a children’s yoga journey they would embark.
Both playful and petiteIt was fate they should meetTwo bold southern girlsSet out on a mission with their hearts’ intuitionTo bring laughter and fun to the yogic tradition.
An trained in Bali, Spain, and HawaiiAbby studied in Italy and New York CityThey met back in Austin with lots of yoga to shareTheir hearts filled with peace and love and oh so aware.From prenatal to babies and children to teensThese two little ladies were training machines.
The Little Yoga House was born in 2010A labor of love, compassion, and zenThe union of yoga, children, and the artsBrings joy to their days and love to their hearts.
 
We want to thank you all ahead of time for your support and for believing in us and our mission!  
Peace, Love & Gratitude, 
Abby & An

story:
Pay it forward by helping a family in need!

On Septmeber 11, 2012 due to heavy local rains a 93 year old earthen flood dike broke and flooded over 60 homes in Santa Clara Utah. Many wonderful families were left with damage and destruction that literally came sweeping with a four foot wall of water. The Basso Family was in the middle of this very unexpected flood. Their yard was swept with mud and debri and their basement was flooded. their children lost beds, dressers and clothes due to the deluge. the walls will need to rebuilt and the carpet replaced. The Basso's are a hard working family with six children and they have had some setbacks due to the economy that has affected us all. This flood hit at a time when resources are slim for this family.

 

What We Need

We are asking for any amount that you can give. We know times are tight for everyone so even a small amount will be appreciated! If many give it can leverage into what is needed. We are asking for a small goal of $5000 even though the rebuild will cost much more. Any money recieved above the needed amount will be paid forward to other neighbors that need it.

  • This funding will go to replace beds, dressers, clothes and needed items for the family.
  • It wil also be applied to replacing the damaged sheetrock, paint, electrical and carpeting so the family can have their rooms back
  • If the goal is not reached any amount recieved will be appreciated and applied to the immediate needs.

The Impact

We are aware that there are a lot of capaigns for floods. Rest assured that if you give to this camapign that you are helping a family in need. This is truly an opportunity to PAY IT FORWARD! I know the Basso's well and they will truly look for ways to help others in need in the future. Thank you for taking the time to care!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this family in need and invite your friends facebook and other media to give to this worthy cause! Any help is very appreciated!

story:
Short Summary:

    Green-HOUSES for HOMELESS, Inc. is a non-profit organization that will be started in Colorado Springs, CO, offering jobs and food (as part of weekly pay) to the homeless and unemployed.

    Greenhouses will be set up for growing organic food that can be sold at local supermarkets and farmer's markets, when in season.  Each employee will receive an hourly wage for their work in the greenhouses and a weekly share of food.  

    GFH will stay in contact with local shelters and help to ensure that all employees have a safe place to stay until they can afford a place of their own.

    GFH is designed simply and effectively so that it can be replicated across the country, or even around the world.  The first center will be established in Colorado Springs, CO, as it is a place where homelessness is a large problem.  Many of the homeless in Colorado Springs are veterans who simply are not getting the assistance they need, yet the recession has landed people from all backgrounds in a situation with no place to go.  

    GFH is also set up to help people help themselves, while also helping out their community and becoming a part of it! With your help, we could make a big impact on our social structure and our human family.  Alleviating homelessness will benefit the whole community, and if this center is successful, they can be established everywhere to combat homelessness, poverty and hunger.  With your help, we could make a big difference!

What We Need & What You Get:

Here is where funding would go:

  • covering costs for proper documentation and state I.D.s for legal employment for prospective employees

  • setting up greenhouses for growing food year-round

  • seeds for leafy greens, nutrients and system to get started

  • covering government fees involved in starting a new business and fees required in order to receive tax-exempt status

How YOU will benefit too:

  • Everyone who donates will be officially listed as either a "Supporter," "Sponsor," "Patron" or "Benefactor!"

  • Everyone who donates will also get a shout-out on Facebook when we reach our goal!

  • YOU get to be a part of something special and get to make a real impact on our world.

What happens if the goal is not reached for funding?

    If the goal is not reached, money will be used to apply for tax-exempt status, which would allow GFH to apply for certain grants and could allow us to find a fiscal sponsor.  Another fundraiser will be launched shortly after this campaign is over, going to the community of Colorado Springs, where the first center will be set up, in order to raise the funds necessary to get the materials we need to get started.  An online auction will also be held shortly after this campaign ends, so check out our Facebook page for updates! (https://www.facebook.com/GreenHOUSESforHOMEless) We are aiming to start setting up in the spring, so hopefully we are able to raise enough funds by then! YOU can help!!  THANK YOU!!!

The Impact:

    For a homeless person to get a job, they first need to have the right documentation to get a state I.D. - or the money to acquire it - either of which could prove to be nearly impossible without any assistance. Even with the proper documents, it costs money just to get a state I.D., which is required in order to be employed in the U.S.  That's where Green-HOUSES for HOMELESS, Inc. comes in.

    First, the center will pay the small price for prospective employees to acquire the proper documents and identification to legally work in the U.S.  Then, the homeless and unemployed will be offered employment to work for an hourly wage (working in the greenhouses and selling the food), as well as a weekly share of food, grown on their own!  The rest of the food grown in the greenhouses will be sold to local supermarkets and farmer's markets (during the summer).  

    The impact of this will be large:

  • Little to no homeless people on the streets or in public places

  • Safer and cleaner living conditions for everyone

  • More productive/involved society and communities

  • Less social unrest

  • Less funds and manpower necessary for the police to devote to homelessness and problems stemming from it

  • A Healthier world with happier people :-)

Other Ways You Can Help:

    It's okay if you can't donate!  Here's how you can still help out by spreading the word to anyone and everyone who may be interested!**

**Sharing on social networks like Facebook and Twitter or even telling your friends and family could be a major help!

*Check out the Indiegogo sharing tools!*

story:
Our Story

I am an artist with a dream.  The first step of my dream is to start an in-home daycare.  In order to start that first step I need to make my home into an affordable, child friendly, fun and dedicated environment.


The Impact

This day care would help out so many families, just in my community alone.  It would create a stable, safe and close to home place for children to wait for Mom and Dad to get home from work.  This would be a great chance, for my husband and I, to start our family and be home for them.  Parents would no longer have to miss work because they could not find someone to watch their little one.  Day or night I would be there for them!


What We Need & What You Get

All the funds from this fundraiser would go into the daycare:

concrete blocks, plywood and 2x4's for the walls, mortar and nails to join them all, stucco and paint to make it look nice,  insulation, laminate wood flooring and pebble tile for the hall and room flooring, pocket doors for the closet and room entrance (space saver), a side door and a security screen door (for safety), concrete to extend the driveway up the side of the house so children can ride bikes a 3 wheelers (away from the street), fencing, cables and wiring to run electricity to new outlets, a ceiling fan to help keep them cool, books, toys and bedding ( for their entertainment, learning and nap time), first aid and other supplies ( crayons, paper, safety scissors, glue, children's music- for education and fun) a permit and a handyman to do it all.  I will post pictures so you can see what your help has done!!


Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -Do It With Others!- Please tell others about my cause!! Tell your friends, your family, your neighbors, that nice person who held the door for you!   Word of mouth is the strongest way to bring attention to my plight!   Don't forget  about the share tools!  Please

story:
An outstanding young physicist, Adilet Imambekov, passed away on July 18, 2012 on Khan Tengri mountain in Kyrgyzstan. Adilet was only 30. Adilet is survived by his wife, Aigerim, and two kids, Dana and Alan, aged one and three.

Despite his short career, Adilet's presence in quantum condensed matter and cold atoms communities was prominent. His work had a strong impact on non-equilibrium physics of low-dimensional systems, and was widely recognized by colleagues.  One of his recent remarkable contribution is the universal theory of nonlinear Luttinger liquids.

Adilet received his B.Sc. degree summa cum laude from Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology in 2002. He did his PhD at Harvard University with Prof. Demler, working on cold atoms and exactly solvable models. Following a two-year postdoc at Yale, Adilet took a position of assistant professor at Rice University in 2009.

Apart from being a brilliant physicist, Adilet was also a highly accomplished athlete, marathon runner and climber. He has conquered Muztagh-Ata peak in China (7546m), and won his first full triathlon just earlier this year in May.

What is most important though, Adilet was a highly interactive, warm, and genuinely kind person. He was among the key participants of many conferences and workshops, and had many close friends both in physics and in climbing communities.

Adilet’s untimely death leaves a void felt by many of us. The least we can do to commemorate our dear friend and outstanding colleague is to provide some support to Adilet's wife, Aigerim Kabdiyeva, and their two children. 

All the funds will be directly deposited to Aigerim Kabdiyeva's account.

Alternatively, you can mail a check, please see http://rlup.rice.edu/view_news.php?uid=39 for details

story:
The beautiful Denise is having a big birthday and we'd love to spoil her with a group donation towards something she really wants - an industrial sewing machine for her business.

Imagine the things she could create with a powerful machine...

Although Denise's birthday is on 30 August, we'll leave this link open until her party on 30 September. If you feel inclined to contribute, please do! Any amount helps.

story:
We are buying flags for kids to welcome Pope Francis to Philadelphia. Donate  $1, $2, $5, or $100 because every dollar helps us welcome the Pope to America! We have purchased many Papal, Christian and Argentine Flags to date to  welcome the Pope to Philadelphia but we need many more to line the Ben Franklin Parkway and Downtown Philly! We will distribute as many flags as we can buy in downtown Philadelphia, primarily to minors, to welcome the Pope in a very special way!

We have already distributed small flags to kids and large 3 by 5 Flags to Nuns and Men of God including Protestant Pastors in the Greater Philadelphia area! Please help us welcome Pope Francis I (Papa Fransisco) to Philadelphia by donating to this worthy cause! Small flags cost us about $1.30 with transportation and large 3 by 5 flags cost a lot more but vary by vendor! Thanks for your help and God Bless you and yours!

story:
The origins of the Spherificator

The Imperial Spherificator is a project years in the making!

We run a small company in Montreal, Quebec, Canada which manufactures a seaweed based caviar substitute called Kelp Caviar. The manufacturing basis of this product line is the same as the one used by chefs all over the world in the process of Spherification, where Alginate, a seaweed extract, is mixed with Calcium to form a caviar, or pearl-like shape. 

For years, chefs, foodies, bakers, bartenders and home cooks have been asking us to find a way to down size our caviar substitute-making machine for household and professional use. After months of R&D, we are ready to introduce to the world the only pearl and caviar handheld forming device: the IMPERIAL SPHERIFICATOR.

About this Project

Once we downsized our technology into a household handheld device for everyone to enjoy at home, we built a prototype to show the world how it works and what can be produced with it. Simply put, the Spherificator can be used to make everything from breakfast to dinner, and even dessert and drinks, more exciting. The Spherificator has no limitations -  what you do with it is up to your imagination and creativity. 

We now have a fully functional prototype and have put it through its paces. We are ready to move forward with production, but need your backing to help us fund the molds and the tooling. 

We guarantee that you will have hours on pleasure with the Spherificator and you will definitely WOW your guests.

About Spherification

Spherification is the culinary process of shaping a liquid into spheres that visually and texturally resemble caviar or roe. With the Spherificator, you will be able to shape almost any item in your kitchen into a pearl/caviar. Whether using raw ingredients (ideal) or commercially available products, the rule of thumb in spherification is to avoid citric acids and ingredients with high acidity levels at all costs. If a product is highly acidic (like tomatoes, Coca Cola, or Tabasco sauce for example), you can dilute the original product to cut the acidity and add a little extra seaweed extract - aka Alginate. Every Spherificator comes with a recipe and quick tip booklet to help you get started. Our website will also have plenty of fun recipes, ideas and tips by delivery date.

Risks and challenges

1. This is a brand new product in the global market and we know that "tons of people want one", but unfortunately that is not a quantifiable order. We hope after two weeks of running our project on Kickstarter it will give us a clear idea of how many Spherificators to order in our first production run.

2. We will ship on a first ordered first delivered priority and will give 100% priority to Kickstarter backers. YOU ARE OUR PRIORITY! We will ensure you receive your Spherificator before the holiday season.

3. We will be shipping globally, we just have to make sure every destination receives the right 6V DC wall plug. To that end, we'll send out a survey after the Kickstarter closes, to ensure you get the right plug!

4. Manufacturing can be a complex process, but we are already in touch with production partners and have built in extra lead time to account for potential delays.

story:
He and his mother were trapped on the roof of their family car as the massive 2011 Queensland floodwaters surrounded them – and as a good samaritan waded in to help Jordan, just 13 years old, insisted his little brother was saved first.

Jordan couldn't swim. He must have been petrified. But he put his fears aside to make sure his brother made it through the terrifying flood.

Moments later, Jordan and his mum were swept to their deaths.

It has been around 4 years, and after spending thousands campaigning to have Jordan given the Cross of Valour, The Rice family have become broke and are now in a homeless shelter, we want to raise around $50,000 to help them in this hard time and find a place for them so they can have a home again.

If we could get 50,000 people to donate just $1 we would reach our target in 60 days. We think this is achievable. 

Please help out a fellow Queenslander and a hero.

story:
The Community Women's Fund

Since 1977, WOMEN'S WAY has strategically invested more than $25 million dollars into the Greater Philadelphia region - making a meaningful difference for our community's women, girls and families. When you give to the WOMEN'S WAY Community Women's Fund Campaign, you can be sure that the dollars will be invested wisely, impacting a wide range of issues and dynamic organizations. 

We know that women's lives are complex and their needs expansive. Instead of supporting just one issue, the Community Women's Fund supports four intersecting priority areas:

  • Economic self-sufficiency and justice
  • Gender violence, including domestic abuse, sexual assault and human trafficking
  • Reproductive and maternal health care
  • Girls' empowerment and leadership development
Click here to learn more about the Community Women's Fund's unique approach.

Your dollars in action!

Our goal of $10,000 will provide funding and technical assistance for one of our grantees doing transformative work for women in girls in the Philadelphia region. Here are just a few examples of projects that the Community Women's Fund have supported...

  • HIAS Pennsylvania - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    HIAS Pennsylvania resettles, reunites and represents migrants who are of limited means residing in Philadelphia and surrounding counties. It seeks the fair treatment and full integration of immigrants from all backgrounds into American society. HIAS PA used a Community Women's Fund grant to collaborate with the Domestic Violence Center of Chester County to provide linguistically and culturally appropriate immigration services to immigrant women who have experienced domestic violence.

    Lutheran Settlement House - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    Lutheran Settlement House is a non-profit, community-based organization committed to serving vulnerable children, adults, and families living in Philadelphia. A $10,000 grant from the Community Women's Fund supported its Counselors Aiding in Recovery from Domestic Violence program, which is a weekly support group for incarcerated women who have experienced domestic violence.

  • Planned Parenthood of Southern New Jersey - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    Planned Parenthood of Southern New Jersey provides health care, sex education, family planning and reproductive health information to thousands of women throughout southern New Jersey. A Community Women's Fund grant is helping the center provide over 90 women with family planning gynecological health care services over the next 12 months.

  • Career WardrobeCareer Wardrobe - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    The Career Wardrobe empowers women in transition by providing professional work attire, educational programs and networking tools and opportunities. Career Wardrobe used a Community Women's Fund grant to expand a pilot program collaborating with local Latina serving nonprofits in an effort to expand its serves to Spanish-speaking women in Philadelphia.

    Friends of Farmworkers - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    At Friends of Farmworkers works to improve the lives of Pennsylvania's low-wage agricultural workforce. This grant will support its Voces de Trabajadores project that brings informal chats to immigrant, female farmworkers to learn about sexual harrassment laws and their rights in combatting sexual harrassment.

    Women’s Therapy Center - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    Women’s Therapy Center is a private, non-profit psychotherapy center providing affordable, high-quality therapeutic services for adult women.  Women’s Therapy Center’s goal is to empower women to live their best, healthiest and most powerful lives by providing services from a feminist perspective and ensuring that women find the therapist and services that best meet their needs.

  • Camp Sojourner - $10,000 Community Women's Fund grant

    The Community Women's Fund supported Camp Sojourner's Girls' Leadership Camp, a nonprofit leadership program that enables girls from Philadelphia to have a one-week sleepaway camp experience. Girls also get involved in our year-round leadership arts, and service activities.

Spread the Love!

  • Make a gift to the Community Women's Fund campaign all throughout March in honor of International Women's Day and Women's History Month.
  • Join our Campaign Team and encourage your friends and family to invest in WOMEN'S WAY.
  • Share your story! Find us on Twitter at @womensway and on Facebook at facebook.com/womensway
  • Follow our Indiegogo campaign throughout the month and receive updates on our progress...and see the growing impact of your gift as you "pay it forward."
story_txt:
The Community Women's FundSince 1977, WOMEN'S WAY has strategically invested more than $25 million dollars into the Greater Philadelphia region - making a meaningful difference for our community's women, girls and families. When you give to the WOMEN'S WAY Community Women's Fund Campaign, you can be sure that the dollars will be invested wisely, impacting a wide range of issues and dynamic organizations. We know that women's lives are complex and their needs expansive. Instead of supporting just one issue, the Community Women's Fund supports four intersecting priority areas:

Economic self-sufficiency and justice

Gender violence, including domestic abuse, sexual assault and human trafficking
Reproductive and maternal health care

Girls' empowerment and leadership development

Click here to learn more about the Community Women's Fund's unique approach.

story:
Who are we?

We are the New Product Development class at Northeastern University in Boston, Massachusetts, and we are creating a new application. We have chosen to undertake a new venture to solve a problem that exists in our day-to-day lives.

The Problem?

We all know that the  process of going out to eat with a group of people can turn into a mess. Indecision runs rampant, conflicting ideas on where to eat, what to eat, and how much to spend.

What is Restaurant Roulette?

Enter Restaurant Roulette, the one-stop destination for all of your dining needs. Menus, addresses, reservation information, and reviews all in one place. However, we do not simply provide you with the appropriate information. Restaurant Roulette, after receiving inputs from everyone in your party, can choose the perfect restaurant that not only meets every member of your party’s needs, but gets you out into your city so that you can explore new restaurants in new neighborhoods for brand new experiences.

How does it work?

Step 1) Invite friends to the Restaurant Roulette “Table”

Step 2) Input personal filters such as likes, dislikes, price-point, and desired location.

Step 3) Spin the wheel. Let Restaurant Roulette provide you with the ideal restaurant for the “Table”.

Step 4) Restaurant selection. Either go forward with the restaurant we have provided you with, or choose the “list” feature to see the next 3 or 5 best matches for an easy selection process.

Step 5) Lets eat! After making your selection, you will be provided with all of the information you need. Restaurant hours, menus, reviews, the address, and either the phone number or the OpenTable link of the restaurant so that you may make a reservation for your party.

The Impact

In a perfect world, everybody would use Restaurant Roulette, and the planet would be ridded of the terrible plague of dining indecision forever!

While we do realize that we are not quite superheroes (yet, anyway), we are simply on a mission to achieve one goal: making your lives easier.

Become closer with your friends by inviting them to go out to the perfect restaurant for all of you and have a great night on the town. Save yourselves the time and hassle of picking where to eat and let us take care of it for you, so you can enjoy the company of your best friends.

Why We Need Your Help?

Sadly, Developing an app is very expensive. We need your help to make Restaurant Roulette a reality, so most of the campaign funds will be going to creating Restaurant Roulette and making it available to you, the public.

We want to create the best dining experience for as many people as possible, so a part of the campaign funds will also go towards spreading the word and making sure everyone knows about Restaurant Roulette to help them rid their lives of indecision.

story:
Our Mission

Rightfully Sewn will provide seamstress training for at-risk women so they can thrive in a specialized workforce that will reestablish Kansas City as an epicenter of garment manufacturing, while at the same time, propel Kansas City fashion designers to market so they can supply the burgeoning demand for affordable, high-quality, American-produced garments.


Through market research, we have discovered Kansas City’s at-risk women population needs:

          •To learn a meaningful trade and gain work experience

          •Job placement assistance with companies that offer livable wages


Kansas City's fashion designers need:

          •Access to space, state-of-the-art fashion technology, and fabric

          •Assistance with marketing, accounting, manufacturing, and merchandising


A. Empower at-risk women by teaching them a trade and assisting them with job placement, thereby elevating them out of a systemic situation

B. Cultivate fashion designers by providing them access to a designated space, state-of-the-art fashion technology, and staffing resources through competitive designer residencies


The $9,000 we raise will be used for the following:

We are lucky to live in a city, state, and nation that offer an amazing amount of grants. Help us contract a professional grantwriter to secure funds for our programs.

We have a beautiful logo and website. Help us bring the rest of our marketing collateral to life (business cards, letterhead, and flyers).

We need legal advice and assistance when drawing up agreements in order to run our organization. Help us patronize a local attorney.

We believe our model can be replicated to help at-risk women and fashion designers in other cities in the future. Help us trademark our brand now to prepare for our future.


This amount is a nod to 2016, a year that is significant to us for two reasons:

First, we hope to be in full capital campaign mode starting by January 2016 and in a building by the end of the same year.

Second, it marks the 100th anniversary of the first Nelly Don dresses sold at Peck’s General Store in downtown Kansas City, Missouri. Behind the Nelly Don brand was the great entrepreneur, Nell Donnelly Reed. She built a fashion empire based in Kansas City, employing thousands of people and manufacturing 75 million dresses from 1916 to 1978. She is an incredible inspiration to us, and we hope to honor her legacy by helping to revive the industry she revolutionized.


Benchmark Research

There is no organization exactly like ours in the nation. Therefore, we have researched different organizations that advance women’s issues, work with at-risk populations, and incubate fashion designers. We are melding all of their best practices together in order to create the most meaningful, well-run organization imaginable.

Are you interested in giving a substantial, tax-deductible donation? Or do you have an operable sewing machine, cutting table, dress form, or another related supply to give? Please contact Founder Jennifer Lapka Pfeifer at jennifer.lapka@rightfullysewn.org.

Do you know friends who would appreciate our cause? Please let them know about our campaign via social media and word of mouth. 

In gratitude,

Rightfully Sewn Team


Jennifer Lapka Pfeifer, Founder

Suzanne Limpic, Events and Merchandising Advisor / Hallmark

Heidi Herrman, Programming and Designer Technology Advisor / Omni Apparel and Heidi Herrman

Valerie Weber, Treasurer / Kansas City Southern

Scott Weber, Secretary / UMB Bank

Sarah Nelsen, Branding Advisor / Interwoven Creative

Lisa Laney, Editor

Jordan Williams, Research Intern

Taylor Barber, Communications Intern

Ritambhara Srinivasan, Project Management Intern

Margie Hogue, Jordan Jamerson, Brooklyn Love, Whitney Manney, Danielle Meister, Lina Qaisy, Godfrey Riddle, Dylan Schoening, Maegan Stracy, Ambassadors

story:
Help us renovate/upgrade/rehabilitate a public space in the village of Los Naranjos, Honduras

My name is Bobby and I'm the owner of D&D Brewery, Lodge, and Restaurant. We're located in the peaceful village of Los Naranjos, Honduras--near Lake Yojoa.

From the day I moved to this small pueblo four years ago, I've driven past a dilapidated outdoor sports area that has a lot of potential but has fallen into disrepair.

Locals have told me that there used to be outdoor basketball leagues, games every night, and even public ceremonies held on this basketball court. 

Originally constructed more than 15 years ago by visiting volunteers, it's in such poor shape now that something must be done. The children of Los Naranjos need more space to safely play sports and the rest of the community deserves better than a run-down, tired patch of blight in an otherwise aesthetically-pleasing village.

This time, though, it's important that the community take ownership of the project instead of only soliciting outside help.

Therefore, local businesses have joined together to pledge matching donation amounts in order to help bring this project to fruition. For every dollar raised here via IndieGoGo, these businesses will match that dollar one-for-one, up to $1,250, for a combined total of $2500. Here is a breakdown of the local business donations:

Finca Paradise Hotel & Coffee Plantation: $250

Ferretera Comercial (Hardware Store): $250

Anonymous Business Donor: $250

D&D Brewery, Lodge, and Restaurant: $500

Total Local Business Contribution: $1,250

Our small town is filled with hard-working people who make their living on subsistence agriculture, construction labor, coffee farming and processing, and tourism. Several local leaders have also pledged free labor to help us handle all construction needs.

The Situation:

Overall, the court is in rough shape. We'll be performing the following improvements and upgrades:

  • The GOOD news is that the cement court/platform is still in near-perfect structural shape. That said, it will need a complete powerwash, a coat of sealer, and a coat of paint
  • Because locals use this court both for basketball as well as mini-soccer, we'll be painting the court for multi-use purposes (lines for basketball and for soccer)
  • All basketball goals will need to be replaced
  • The seating areas will need to be completely overhauled
  • While electrical & wiring is present and functional for lighting at nighttime, the fixtures are obsolete and do not cover the entire court; they'll be replaced
  • There's currently no barrier on 2 of the court's 4 sides preventing the ball from landing in small drainage creeks. We'll put up fencing/netting there
  • We'll also do beautification of the area and the walkway up to the court with landscaping and gravel
  • Trimming of trees that are blocking light fixtures and encroaching on the court

We'll be ordering extremely high-quality, hurricane-resistant outdoor basketball goals from the U.S. These are rated to last 15-20 years. 

We'll also be constructing, with local metalworkers, small padded soccer goals that can be inserted and removed which will attach to the basketball goals.

What's the impact of this project? 

This project will:

  • Provide a safe place for everyone in Los Naranjos and surrounding areas to safely practice basketball and soccer both day and night
  • Turn an eyesore for the community into a source of pride
  • Unite local business leaders, local community leaders, and you!
  • This court is actually located next to the local school, so this project will be an enormous improvement for schoolchildren in the village! They'll be able to have their P.E. class under much better circumstances.

Who will be receiving the money?

  • Me, Bobby, the coordinator of this project and the owner of D&D Brewery
  • All expenditures will be reviewed by volunteer auditors at the end of the project to certify that these funds were used correctly

How any additional funds over the $1,250 goal will be used

Should we go above our goal of $1,250 (which would be awesome!) we'll use those extra funds for the following:
  • Covering of all fees incurred during fundraising (credit card fees, administrative fees, etc.) 
  • Further beautification including covering the brick wall facing one side of the court with stucco and inviting artists from San Pedro Sula to paint murals
  • Purchasing plenty of basketballs, soccer balls, and air pumps to donate to the local school
  • Purchases of future nets and other maintenance items for the court

story:
Who are we?

Hello! We are Denverites Patrick and Mara Tcheunou, and we are starting a for-profit organic coffee- and cocoa-farming enterprise in the central African nation of Cameroon. A guiding principle of our business model will be to provide positive social impact on site, primarily by promoting fair trade practices, workforce gender equality, and environmental conservation.

                              

Patrick, a U.S.-trained chemical engineer, is a native of Cameroon who grew up farming food crops as well as coffee. Mara is a self-employed therapist with business ownership experience and a knack for connecting and communicating with people.

Our Motivations

We believe that traditional charity has great merit but does not always provide lasting change. Charity can help fight disease, bring food and shelter to the poor, and can help build a school. However, it will not make a family or a country self-sufficient.  We believe that we need to help build a solid foundation for self-empowerment and lasting development.

We need to give women and men in Cameroon the opportunity to help themselves by providing them with job opportunities, flexible schedules and fair pay, showing them good business models, and promoting education for their children. 

The Smart Globe International Project

It is about developing 500 acres of land in the North West province of Cameroon for Arabica coffee farming and 500 acres of land in the Center province for cacao farming. We need your help obtaining seeds for coffee, cocoa and others crops for bio-diversification. 

                  

This funding will allow us to purchase nearly 200,000 seeds. The total estimated cost to get this seed project off the ground is $105,000. Our exact budget breakdown can be viewed below.

How your money will be spent

We will need $105,000 to launch this project. This is how your hard earned money will be spent:


Other Ways to Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not, please help us get the word out by sharing our campaign page with your email and social media contacts.


The Dream Team!


The Way Forward

Whatever funds are raised will go towards starting this project in earnest and will allow Smart Globe International to commence operations at a smaller level to implement our vision.  If we do not reach our entire fundraising goal we will scale down and purchase a smaller quantity of coffee and cocoa seeds for the farms.  We will invest in a greater proportion of bio-diversification crop seeds, such as peppers and soybeans, in order to sell those crops and raise money for the future purchase of more coffee and cocoa seeds.  


Road Blocks

Our approach to prevent or fight pests and disease will be a combination of different proven solutions. We will plant disease resistant varieties, such as Java for Arabica Coffee, plant pepper which repels insects and alternate different varieties of trees. This alternation and addition to including bio-diversification trees creates a barrier and reduces the spread of pests. Organic spray to fight insect and fungi could be used as well. Shade control and pruning are other approaches to prevent or limit the risk of plant diseases that we will use.

Price volatility of both coffee and cocoa is another possible challenge.  By farming both crops we expect to balance any challenges that might arise if the focus was on just one. Coffee and cocoa prices are expected to increase as demand keeps growing and production keeps dropping.


Our Blog Articles

Women and Coffee Farming in Cameroon: An Interesting Dynamic

Climate Change and Cocoa Farming in Cameroon

The Smart Globe International story

Some of our Supporters


In the News

Grow Africa organization presents Smart Globe International

Globe International Project 

It is about developing 500 acres of land in the North
West province of Cameroon for Arabica coffee farming and 500 acres of land in
the Center province for cacao farming. We need your help obtaining seeds for
coffee, cocoa and others crops for bio-diversification. 
                   
This funding will allow
us to purchase nearly 200,000 seeds. The total estimated cost to get this seed
project off the ground is $105,000. Our exact budget breakdown can be viewed
below.


How your money will be spent
We will need
$105,000 to launch this project. This is how your hard earned money will be
spent:



Other Ways to Help

Whether you are able to contribute or not, please help us get the word out by sharing our campaign page with your email and social media contacts.



The Dream Team!





The Way Forward

Whatever funds are raised will go towards starting this project in earnest and will allow Smart Globe International to commence operations at a smaller level to implement our vision.  If we do not reach our entire fundraising goal we will scale down and purchase a smaller quantity of coffee and cocoa seeds for the farms.  We will invest in a greater proportion of bio-diversification crop seeds, such as peppers and soybeans, in order to sell those crops and raise money for the future purchase of more coffee and cocoa seeds.   


 
   


Road Blocks

Our approach to
prevent or fight pests and disease will be a combination of different proven solutions. We will plant disease resistant varieties, such as Java for
Arabica Coffee, plant pepper which repels insects and alternate different varieties
of trees. This alternation and addition to including bio-diversification trees creates a barrier and reduces the spread of pests. Organic spray to fight insect and fungi could be used as well. Shade
control and pruning are other approaches to prevent or limit the risk of
plant diseases that we will use.



Price volatility of both coffee and cocoa is another possible challenge.  By farming both crops we expect to balance any challenges that might arise if the focus was on just one. Coffee and cocoa prices are expected to
increase as demand keeps growing and production keeps dropping.


Our Blog Articles
Women and Coffee Farming in Cameroon: An Interesting Dynamic
Climate Change and Cocoa Farming in Cameroon
The Smart Globe International story
Some of our Supporters



In the News
Grow Africa organization presents Smart Globe International

story:
It fills my heart with joy to see my goal reached!

I have given this site the notice that I wish to stop receiving funds now. This takes 3 days to come into effect. As of July 18th the possibility to donate will be stopped. I have given this stop because I feel wrong to receive even more, now that I have reached my goal and beyond. 

I thank you all from the bottom of my heart. I have watched this space with a smile on my face while having a lump in my throat and tears of pure happiness running down my face.

I will be using the extra money to put new locks and a security system in my house. 


My name is Miriam with the Hat and my house got ransacked! 

I am Dutch but I live and work in Greece. Today when I got home from work I found my house in shambles, someone had broken into my house and ransacked the place. Some emotional valuables were stolen that can never be replaced like my dead mothers gold signature ring and a gold friendship ring from a dear friend. The other things that were stolen; a smart phone, 3 antique watches, and my mini disc recorder, I do not care about so much. But what is hurting right now is the 250 euro in cash that was stolen! Because of the current situation in Greece I kept cash in the house that I painfully went to stand in line for at the ATM every day. The money was there to buy food for myself and my pets for the next couple of weeks.

I desperately need 250 euro again to buy food for myself and my pets. 

I know the funding limit above says 500 but that was the smallest amount this site could do. 

I helped Miriam with the Hat and all I got was this lousy postcard...

I will send each and everyone of you who contributes at least 5 euro a personal, handwritten postcard from Greece. I know it is not much but it is the least I can do!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks! 
Miriam with the Hat

story:
What is Atmosphr?

Atmosphr is a software platform that makes your ideas come to life in a matter of minutes using VR. It is like playing The Sims in your browser - it is that easy. 

What can you do with Atmosphr?

  • Design spaces for VR on your browser and store your creations in the cloud - no software to be downloaded or installed.
  • Drag and Drop assets around the room as you would in a game. No reinventing the wheel!
  • Design and visualise rooms to your specifications.
  • Upload your own custom 3D models or 3D models from the internet into our tool.
  • Toggle to view your creation from a First-Person perspective on your phone through VR. That is, you can view what you made from inside your creation.
  • NO CODING. Just a sense of basic aesthetics will do!

Why Atmosphr?

Sketching out plans for events and room interiors, for instance, is hard, especially so when you cannot visualise what you are designing. 
We solve this with the use of Virtual Reality (VR).
VR is not as accessible for non-designers and casual users who wish to design and visualise from the comfort of their homes - there are various tools that allow for 3D Design but all of them require varying degrees of software installations, a 3D design background and programming, all of which prevents the majority from embracing creating for VR. We change this.

Who is this for?

Interior decorators, event planners, set designers, advertisers... anyone needing to test out a quick design for their needs can do so with Atmosphr in a jiffy. 

What We Need

We've built a working prototype of Atmosphr and we need your help to make the polished version of the product a reality.
  • Infrastructural costs - servers and other hardware.
  • Bringing more engineers on board who share the same vision for Accessible VR for everyone. 

Perks

There are lots of perks available for our backers as well as the opportunity to be a Tester for our Private Beta, scheduled to launch in December 2015. All other backers about $5 will be welcome to our Open Beta, scheduled for January 2016.
You could get your hands on some Limited Edition Atmosphr T-shirts which fit like a dream and look impeccable. 

Of course, no VR product is complete without a headset and we're providing custom Cardboards to our backers!


For interested businesses, there is an opportunity to work with us and craft custom solutions that utilise the Atmosphr platform.

The Impact

VR will make a difference to our lives, and is already doing so with entertainment and games. We strongly believe in the power of VR to shape human experiences and, with Atmosphr, we want to enable you to shape those experiences.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help with supporting us with funds, it's alright! What you could do instead is:
  • Share this campaign page with every relative and friend you know. Every single one of them. 
  • Like our page on Facebook and sign up for our mailing list at our website.

The Team

We thank you for your support! Visit our website to know more about Atmosphr.

story:
Summary

IdealEthos is unlike other consulting firms. Our work accelerates the shift from the outdated and singular focus of profit-driven business models that dominated the 20th century to a more holistic, authentic model that embraces considerations for people, planet and profit now and into the future.

Our services focus first on customized sustainability assessments and reporting using the Global Reporting Initiative’s framework. These assessments provide a baseline for understanding what a business is already doing well and where it can improve. IdealEthos can then guide a business through the creation of programs and initiatives while connecting them more meaningfully with their communities. IdealEthos is a consulting firm committed to assisting in the transformation of businesses to sustainable and socially responsible organizations that thrive on making a profit while working with people in their communities and reducing impact on the planet.

About the Founder:

Christina Ceballos has 18 years of experience working in business, communities and on environmental issues in a variety of fields. She has worked in education, human rights and international development in the non-profit and government sectors. After finishing two years of service in Peace Corps in Mali, West Africa in 2007, she moved to Austin. 

Since, she has co-founded an environmental education nonprofit and worked for an international environmental advocacy organization. While working toward her master’s degree in Organizational Leadership and Ethics in the school of business at St. Edward’s University, she saw enormous untapped potential for businesses in the realm of corporate social responsibility. The key to unlocking this potential and shifting it from a purely public relations and marketing perspective to being an effective vehicle for transforming business is organizational learning and authentic, deliberate action.

About this Campaign:

The goal of this campaign is to raise funds to attend the 5th Bi-Annual Global Reporting Initiative conference in May 2016. This campaign could not have happened without the support and guidance of the Austin+SocialGood team and for that we are immensely grateful.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funding to help offset the costs attending the 5th Bi-Annual Global Reporting Initiative Conference. This conference is held once every other year and is a tremendous opportunity for IdealEthos to raise it's profile globally.

Cost of Attendance: 

The conference runs from May 18-20, 2016. In order to overcome the effects of jet-lag and to provide enough time to network and follow-up with contacts after the conference, the aim is to arrive May 16th and depart May 23rd for a total of 7 days/nights.

  • 850 Euros or $965 US Dollars for conference registration for a non-member organization from an OECD country
  • 250 Euros or $285 US Dollars for attending Master Classes in the morning on 5/18/16 and in the afternoon on 5/20/16.
  • Round-trip Airfare from Austin to Amsterdam, $1,500 US Dollars
  • 7 nights in a hotel, $1,400 US Dollars
  • 7 days for meals, $700 US Dollars
  • $200 for transit and other incidentals while there

TOTAL: $5,050 US DOLLARS

Why is IdealEthos offering two unique sets of perks?

Given that we are a social enterprise consulting firm, we wanted to offer both physical perks for non-business owners and services as perks for our business owner supporters. And here's how we are going to do it:

For our Founding Supporters, we are offering the perks below tailored for an individual IndieGoGo supporter. IdealEthos’ logo was designed by a friend of IdealEthos, Nick Comito, in 2014. The symbol in our logo represents a geometric Venn diagram. The overlapping three layers represent the various stakeholder considerations that must be taken into account when making critical and ethical organizational decisions.

For $10, and as our Founding Supporter, you get our gratitude and a Virtual High Five!

For $25, and as our Wearable Founding Supporter, receive a Virtual High Five delivered right to your inbox, a special mention on IdealEthos' website and a T-shirt to show off your support of the Austin+SocialGood program!!!

            

For $50, and as our Stash Founding Supporter, receive a Virtual High Five delivered right to your inbox, special mention on IdealEthos' website and a Reusable IdealEthos Tote Bag like this one below!!!

                                   

For $100, and as our Excellent Founding Supporter, get the Virtual High Five delivered right to your inbox, special mention on IdealEthos' website, an Austin+Social Good T-shirt and a .6 liter Stainless Steel IdealEthos Reusable Water Bottle!!!

                                                             

For $200, as our All-In Founding Supporter, you get the whole shebang!!! All perks listed above!

For our IdealEthos Business Leaders, we want to help businesses either start on or advance their social responsibility and sustainability journeys. We are offering our services to our business supporters in the following ways:

For $250, our IdealEthos Business Leader I's will get access to two live webinars of 60 minutes each on social responsibility and sustainability. These webisne designed for emerging CSR leaders who want to get more informed on the topic. Supporting at this level will get you and your business special recognition on IdealEthos' website and social media channels.

For $500, our IdealEthos Business Leader II's will get two business consultations by phone or video-conference of 60 minutes each. You will be introduced to the world of sustainability reporting. You will receive a list of observations, recommendations and a high-level plan of action going forward tailored specifically for your business. CSR Leader II's will have special recognition on IdealEthos' website and social media channels.

For $1,500, IdealEthos Business Leader III's will get an in-person consultation and site visit of their most important operations. You will receive original research, an introduction to sustainability reporting and have a high-level plan of action going forward. CSR Leader III's will have special recognition on IdealEthos' social media channels. We will link to your website from ours for one year. Companies must operate in the lower-48 United States. Multiple site visits in one metro area/region only.

For $5,000, Committed IdealEthos Leaders will receive an internal sustainability report which includes identification of stakeholders, original research on industry issues and future trends and a full list of recommendations for improvements. Special recognition on our website and social media channels, including links to your website for one year. Companies must operate in the lower-48 United States. Multiple site visits in one metro area/region only.

What if you don’t reach your goal?

If we don’t receive all of the funds requested, we apply what we have raised and try to supplement with other funds we get through our consulting services.

The Impact

Supporting IdealEthos on this campaign will help in the continuing education of its founder, Christina Ceballos, while providing a perfect opportunity to meet with global leaders from companies wanting to do this work. During the conference, Christina will share regular updates from the conference via social media channels with followers. 

Risks & Challenges

There are risks and challenges that lay ahead. Most important is creating valuable services for clients and answering the WIIFM question. With support from this campaign, we will be able to deliver IdealEthos’ services to answer what the market needs and wants. Our goal is to get in front of at least 50 different business leaders and industry associations in the next year.

As a resourceful and resilient organization, IdealEthos has always been able to reach the next level of development by digging down deep to find solutions and reaching out to ask for the support we need from our community. Christina Ceballos has already boot-strapped the past year and found ways to bring in money when times were lean. For example, in August she began teaching part-time at St. Edward’s University. She loves teaching the Global Business Responsibility & Ethics (Global CSR) course to undergraduate business majors – our country’s future business leaders. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If IdealEthos resonates with you, we would be grateful if you can share this campaign and pay it forward digitally. Who knows what ripple effect you may cause!? If you are able, support us and grab some great perks while you’re at it! Also, and as long as we have your attention and affection, please like us on Facebook and check out our website links below!

story:
Evans Theatres Robinson Crossing 6 will be owned by RAE Entertainment Group a company formed by Martin and Pamella Evans. Parents of 9 children  and over 14 grandchildren they understand the need for an AFFORDABLE alternative to the main stream megaplex movie theatres. Families and young adults need an affordable alternative with the same  food options and quality viewing experience. We plan to provide just that to the community of Norman, OK and surrounding area.

Along with exceptional customer service, the biggest 2nd run movies and a variety of old favorites; RAE Entertainment Group will be offering a wide variety of unique concessions and treats. During the beginning stages of start-up we are scouting for unique treats to offer our customers that will include frozen drinks, exotic or unique candies, and unique “Amusement Park” style concessions like funnel cakes, and fudge puppies. We have explored the option of serving traditional foods like sandwiches and pizza. Some of these treats people may not have access to at current family oriented entertainment destinations or cinemas in the local area. This will only add to the exceptional customer service we plan to provide. We will accomplish this by hiring well qualified applicants for our management team. Selecting the best applicants for our staff members, who demonstrate the ability to meet or exceed the exceptional level of customer service and quality entertainment experience we seek to provide. On-site training of staff to ensure they know exactly what is expected of them. Aggressive local marketing channeled at our local community and then abroad to surrounding areas.

RAE Entertainment Group expects to see customer counts exceeding 180,000 guests by year 2. Total project start-up cost is $80,000.

Filling a void in the local community will be an added bonus to providing the local area with an affordable and CLEAN place for their families to hang out and enjoy time together. We want to be known as the friendliest and CLEANEST theatre in town even if we don't play the movies first...we want to be the best.

RAE Entertainment has considered several other potential locations. This location feels right and is located in a shopping center that consists of several regional and local retail shops and businesses. The cinema located at 1300 N. Interstate Drive Norman, OK is undergoing major upgrades and renovations. The current property owner is replacing the roof and HVAC . He will also be installing new upgraded seating in all auditoriums and updating the lobby. In a partnership between RAE Entertainment Group Inc. and the landlord we will be installing new state of the art digital projection and sound equipment, new screens and all new drapes in the auditoriums total upgrades and renovations are more than $550,000. This will modernize the facility and breathe new life into this well liked cinema location.

We are asking for YOUR help to make this happen we need to raise $15,000. These proceeds will be used to finish upgrades to the facility, purchase concession equipment, building signage, point of sale systems and film studio advances. Please join us in creating a better mix of affordable family entertainment for Norman Oklahoma.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

You have given us so much support already and for that we are very grateful. We want to see this project really take off and provide something special to everyone of our customers. Please help us in making this a reality not just for us but for Norman.

exotic or unique candies, and unique “Amusement Park” style concessions like funnel
cakes, and fudge puppies. We have explored the option of serving traditional
foods like sandwiches and pizza. Some of these treats people may not have
access to at current family oriented entertainment destinations or cinemas in
the local area. This will only add to the exceptional customer service we plan
to provide. We will accomplish this by hiring well qualified applicants for our
management team. Selecting the best applicants for our staff members, who
demonstrate the ability to meet or exceed the exceptional level of customer
service and quality entertainment experience we seek to provide. On-site
training of staff to ensure they know exactly what is expected of them.
Aggressive local marketing channeled at our local community and then abroad to
surrounding areas.

RAE Entertainment Group
expects to see customer counts exceeding 180,000 guests by year 2. Total project start-up cost is $80,000.

Filling a void in the
local community will be an added bonus to providing the local area with an
affordable and CLEAN place for their families to hang out and enjoy time together. We want to be known as the friendliest and CLEANEST theatre in town even if we don't play the movies first...we want to be the best.

RAE Entertainment has considered several other
potential locations. This location feels right and is located in a shopping
center that consists of several regional and local retail shops and businesses. The cinema located at
1300 N. Interstate Drive Norman, OK is undergoing major upgrades and
renovations. The current property owner is replacing the roof and HVAC . He will also be installing new upgraded seating in all auditoriums
and updating the lobby. In a partnership between RAE Entertainment Group Inc.
and the landlord we will be installing new state of the art digital projection
and sound equipment, new screens and all new drapes in the auditoriums total
upgrades and renovations are more than $550,000. This will modernize the facility and
breathe new life into this well liked cinema location. 

We are asking for YOUR help to make this happen we need to raise $15,000. These proceeds will be
used to finish upgrades to the facility, purchase concession equipment,
building signage, point of sale systems and film studio advances. Please join us in creating a better mix of
affordable family entertainment for Norman Oklahoma. Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   You have given us so much support already and for that we are very grateful. We want to see this project really take off and provide something special to everyone of our customers. Please help us in making this a reality not just for us but for Norman.
