story:
About SLIMEAPALOOZA

www.slimeapalooza.com / www.slimerun.com

Ever gushed with envy when you watched other people get slimed on TV? Well, gush no more! Here’s your very chance to live that childhood dream of getting up close and VERY personal with the famous green ooze.

Slimeapalooza is a ridiculously fun, and wildly messy obstacle course event. Outfitted with wild and imaginative obstacles and challenges. This isn’t your ordinary mud race! Not one bit! This event replaces your conventional mud fueled obstacles with the beloved Nickelodeon-esque Slime.Lets put those grueling mud races in your rear view mirror. Its time for you to have some guilt-free fun and get a little messy (and green) in life.

When & Where Will It Take Place?

Date: July 20th, 2013 - Saturday 

Venue: 

Tuxedo Ridge ( 581 New York 17A Tuxedo Park, NY 10987 ) is conveniently located an hour away from New York City. For a better reference, its 18 minutes away from Woodbury Commons Outlet. A ski lodge during winter season, Tuxedo Ridge transform into one of the premiere outdoor event venues during the spring and summer season. 

 

How Does It Work?

You’ll be running (walking, crawling, hopping or waddling) a 5K obstacle course. The course, roughly 3.1 miles in length, will host a series of obstacles and challenges for you to overcome. (Obstacles listed down below)
 
Don’t you worry, it is not a strenuous or difficult course but staying healthy and active prior to the event is highly encouraged. Who really wants to face plant the ground during such an exciting event? 
 

Our Guest of Honor - The Slime

If you're like us, you cannot to wait for that moment that little green monster smacks you right across the face in all its glory. Just thinking about it gives us goose pimples!

 

Our buddy, Spencer, was kind enough to loan us his mind, body and soul to showcase The Slime in action - Check it out in the Gallery page or click HERE - We promise it's well worth your minute!

 

The Slime is a semi-viscous substance that is completely organic and stated by the manufacturer as “completely safe for human contact and immersion.” The Slime is synonymous with Nickelodeon ® and its Kid Choice Awards® where celebrities and the studio audience are often sprayed with the Slime demonstrating the incredible safe nature of the Slime. 

Who Are We & Why Are We Doing This.

We're a small team from New York City dedicated to bringing you an event that you'll never forget.

We're tired of the tough, competitive, grungy mud run events and just wanted to have a nice day to ourselves to let loose and relive those childhood memories of watching other people get the royal slime treatment. 

Its our turn to get messy & we're bringing you all on the journey with us!

Fund Allocation 

So, where will the funds go? Great question! 

About 50% of the proposed campaign goal will go towards the deposit for the venue, Tuxedo Ridge. 

The rest of the funds will be allocated to

- Event Insurance

- Deposit on obstacle construction

- Deposit on slime (we're going to have a MAMMOTH amount of slime for you guys)

- Miscellaneous cost in prepping for an event as big as Slimeapalooza

 

The funds will NOT be used for payroll for the Slimeapalooza team. We are working pro bono - for the greater good of humanity! We're really excited to be bringing such an event to the masses and we want all of the funds to be allocated to producing the best event possible. 

 

With that being said, the goal is to raise enough to get the ball rolling. We're still taking on significant financial risk ourselves to get the event fully operational. So anything more than our proposed goal will lessen the burden for us. And the more we have to work with the better the production of Slimeapalooza will be. 

THE PERKS  

a/k/a The Fun Stuff 


The awesome part of this campaign is that virtually all of the perks being offered guarantee you (1) admission to Slimeapalooza.

By supporting the campaign, you're also saying I or someone I hold dearly to my warm fuzzy heart would LOVE to be part of something amazing. 

The Perks are set up in a tiered system that benefits those early "adopters." So the earlier you register, the cheaper the price of admission will be. Once a tier is sold out, we would move to the next price point and the price continues to raise until the final tier.

There are also combo perks that allow you to not only lock in your admission at a certain price point but get you an extra good, such as a T-shirt or other benefits.

And any contribution to our campaign is greatly appreciated from the bottom of our slimed filled hearts.

Volunteers 

Love the concept but for whatever reason can't contribute? No biggie! We're looking for people to donate their time and energy to making the event a success. If you have a special talent you think could help make Slimeapalooza a smashing hit then please do not hesitate to contact us. 

You can also help by spreading the word! Sharing this page with friends and your network of acquaintances. The more eyes we have looking at this page, the better chances we have of reaching our goal.

So please do us a huge favor and SHARE! Earn uber cool points by being the first to find out about Slimeapalooza.

story:
Short Summary

I am a 39 year old mother of two starting a new career. Most of my career has been as a print advertising Account Executive, but changing times, family dynamics, and the economy have aligned in such a way that I can redefine myself and follow my passion - therapeutic massage. I am in the final 3 weeks of massage school, I have already passed my state exam, and I just need a bit of funding to open my own office. 

What We Need & What You Get

I have been fortunate enough to find a great office location right in the center of Fort Myers for only $100 per month. To secure this location and be ready for business, I am facing the following costs:

  • Business license $100
  • Rent $110
  • Establishment license $300
  • Malpractice Insurance $100
  • New Massage Table $280
  • Misc (lotion, office supplies, etc) 

Much of the legwork has been done. I have been building my business since October by offering in home massages, and I have a base of about 60 active clients. I have an existing business page on Facebook from which I have been promoting my business (https://www.facebook.com/KandaceBlevinMassageTherapy), and I have a marketing plan in place. I just need the remaining funding to open my doors and establish my business.

For those that ae willing and able to contribute, I will offer massage sessions up to 1.5 times your contribution (massage costs $70, you contribute $140, I give you 3 one hour massages). I will also list your name and business on my web page as a founding sponsor for my business.

The Impact

Many people hurt every day and suffer with back pain, neck pain, stress, fibromyalgia, and insomnia to name a few. Massage Therapy is an excellent way to treat these conditions and contribute to the general wellness and well being. I have been told that I am a very talented massage therapist, and it is my goal and desire to be in this business for the rest of my life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to my campaign, I certainly understand. You can help me by spreading the word about me, and perhaps connecting with me on Facebook www.facebook.com/KandaceBlevinMassageTherapy and Linkedin www.linkedin.com/in/kandaceblevin.

story:
Who I am

My name is Trevor, and I have been a graphic/web designer for over 10 years, for conscious authors & businesses like Neale Donald Walsch, Bo Eason, Gary Zukav & Lionsgate Films.

What this is about

I’ve attended events, conferences, retreats, seminars and service projects: I have had these epiphanies, self-realizations, experiences of pure service, presence and connection, and then I will go home and feel this ‘event high’ for a week or so, but sooner or later I begin to feel isolated and unsupported, fall back into old habits, and I’m suddenly right back where I started.

There are countless people striving to stay committed to their personal growth, stay connected to their own potential, and failing to keep that connection going because they do not have a supportive group of like-minded people they can reach out to for help and encouragement.

TheJourneyInward.com will be a FREE Online Community where you can find inspiring quotes and stories, share some of your most meaningful stories and sayings from your life, and find support from like-minded individuals and groups who are interested in self-discovery. 

What we need

Help us build this project by contributing! It only takes a small contribution to help us get started:

We are providing a place where people can connect with like-minded individuals and receive help and support around their own personal journey. If you are interested in having this in your life, or are inspired by this project, please support our dedicated team of volunteers and contributors and help us build a place where we can all be supported in our own personal growth.

Where do the funds go?

All the money we raise will go towards the development of the website (programming & graphics, developing the support system, marketing, etc.) Anything left over will go towards future improvements to the site.

What if we don't reach our funding goal?

We are still going to build this project! It may take a little longer, though... any money we make that falls short of our goal will still go towards this project. Every little bit helps!

What You Get

A chance to serve your community, and find meaning in the work you’re doing. Also, here are some additional perks:

  1. Contribute $5: We will personally thank every contributor by name (if given) on our Facebook page!
     
  2. Contribute $25: Receive the "'Reminders' From the Soul" mini-book.
     
  3. Contribute $100: Receive the mini-book and an inspirational poster.
     
  4. Contribute $500: Receive the mini-book, the poster, and a credit line & link on the website.

The Impact

The Journey Inward will provide support and inspiration for people who are looking for more meaning and connection in their lives. We will create and support a community of people that are interested in going within. This will be a place where people can contribute and benefit from the lessons of their peers; where introspective people can feel like they belong; where people can find other like-minded individuals to connect with, and get support on whatever they’re working on. Have philosophical discussions; join a group around health, or facing your fears, or relationships; find a friend who will hold them accountable to their commitments to themselves… in short, a place where we can journey inward, together.

How it works

  1. People visit the site looking for support and inspiration. They read the quotes and personal stories others post and are inspired and moved by them.
     
  2. They can then add their own favorite meaningful quotes (brainyquotes.com) and share personal stories (chickensoup.com), or add comments to other quotes and stories.
     
  3. These quotes and stories act as a gateway into the support system: They can see how many contributors are available for groups or accountability partnerships, then send an invite to all the people attached to a particular topic or category to be in a related group.
     
  4. The groups are organized systems that allow individuals to create and manage groups & relationships (like meetup.com or supportgroup.com), receive notifications, set goals & events, have conference calls or chat room meetings and discussion groups on an ongoing basis.

“Helping someone else is often the fastest way to help ourselves.”

  • Wouldn’t it be great if you could connect with others who have run into the same obstacles that you have?
  • Or find people who are willing to keep you accountable to yourself?
  • Or just meet someone else who is also interested in self-discovery?

If are interested in or inspired by this project, please support us and help us build a place that will support and inspire all of us.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this project with others: Check out our Facebook page or use the IndieGoGo share tools.
  • Join our team: Sign up for The Journey Inward on VolunteerSpot today!

Other Ways You Can Help


Share this project with others: Check out our Facebook page or use the IndieGoGo share tools.




Join our team: Sign up for The Journey Inward on VolunteerSpot today!

story:
Our Story:

In May 2013 I had the opportunity to travel to Kenya to visit my sister in Busia, Kenya. However, I also got the chance to meet up with my friend, Collins Ambuchi, who was my crew leader when I served in the Cleaning and Maintenance Department of the Bahá'i World Centre in Haifa, Israel from July 2009-2010 during my year of serivce after high school.

Since Collins had returned to Kenya he had started a small cleaning business called Star Clean Ltd. He has a very clear vision for his business: He wants to deliver excellent service and provide fair wages for his employees. 

In May, when I visited, his business had a few employees and a couple contracts but it needed (and still needs to) to expand. Unfortunately, Collins isn't able to access a loan for this purpose without putting up some type of asset as collateral.

I've worked with Collins and I know his work ethic and I that's why I promised him that when I returned to the United States I would try to help raise him the funds he needed to expand. He insisted that he would repay any money loaned to him (as you see he expresses in the video) but I assured him that it would be easier to raise the money for him on a crowd funding platform and that by doing so he would be free to use the funds we rasied in whatever way he saw fit to expand his business. 

What We Need:

Our funding goal: $2,800 USD

If we reach our goal the funds will be used to run an advertising campaign in order to secure more contracts. If we exceed our funding goal the additional funds will be used towards the purchase of an office computer, an additional floor buffer, and/or rug doctor. 

Why Star Clean Ltd. Is Different:

The cleaning business in Kenya is rife with managers or owners taking advantage of laborers due to the fact that the jobless rate is high. Star Clean Ltd. has been founded in Kenya with the following vision:

  • to create employment opportunities for young people
  • offer these youth training in professional cleaning
  • improve the lives of workers by offering fair wages

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

You might not able to back our campaign financially, but perhaps you can with your voice. Please share our campaign on Facebook, via email, or by word of mouth.

story:
Our Story

Holiday Ranch is the Vision of David and Amanda Honn.  We want to create a place where families can go to experience and create lasting holiday memories all year long. 

We are creating a Country Ranch atmosphere with a Victorian Style retail Village for new and small business owners near Oklahoma City.  The Ranch will be a working ranch complete with seasonal vegetables used in our own cafe and sold at our on site Farmers Market.  The Victorian Style Village will have individual cottages for local artists and crafters to display their hand made wares all year long.  The village will be complete with cobblestone streets, gas street lights, large central gazebo,  wooden covered sidewalks and strolling entertainment during weekends and holidays. 

Holiday Ranch will also be a gathering place for local communities and groups.  A Banquet Hall will be located near the Victorian Village with space for business meetings, community groups, weddings, and reunions.  Local schools will be able to have class outings and tours.  High schools and churches will have a place for their bands or choirs to perform.  Families will be able to meet and gather for special holiday events.

Holiday Events will include;

Halloween;      Pumpkin Patch, Hay Rides, Kids Haunted House, Adult Haunted House, Haunted Hay Rides, Face Panting, Pumpkin Carving Contest, Petting Zoo, Ghost Stories told by the Fire Pit, Strolling Magicians, Musical Entertainment on outdoor Stage from Local schools.

Thanksgiving;  Turkey Dinners to Go from Gift Shop, Pumpkin Decorations, Homemade pies, Strolling Carolers, Strolling Magicians, Strolling Entertainment, Farmers Market, Outdoor Events, Entertainment on outdoor Stage from Local schools, Petting Zoo, Carols by Fire Pit.

Christmas;       Christmas Trees for sale, Turkey Dinners to Go, Homemade pies, Strolling Carolers, Carols by the Fire pit, Outdoor Event space, Entertainment on outdoor stage from Local Schools, Petting Zoo.

Easter;             Easter Egg Hunt, Easter Bunny House, Face Painting, Petting Zoo, Farmers Market, Strolling Entertainment, Entertainment on outdoor Stage from Local Schools        


The Impact

With the creation of Holiday Ranch, we will be able to provide numerous jobs for the community as well as helping other small and new business owners start their dream of owning their own business.

Holiday Ranch will provide low cost / free community meeting space for the local municipalities to use.

At the Holiday Ranch, we want to create for you a place to relive those favorite holiday memories or create new memories for your family to remember for years to come.

. 


What We Need & What You Get

Holiday Ranch is looking for initial start up funding for the legal formation of the company in Oklahoma.  We need $5000.00 for lawyer and accounting fees to form the company.  The legal formation of the company will allow us to promote and recruit other partners who wish to be involved in the start up of this great idea.  Holiday Ranch can be a great economic boost to the local communities, creating jobs, helping small business owners, and providing a community space for the surrounding municipalities. With your help this can be a true community project.  Please donate and help get this business started.


Other Ways You Can Help

Holiday Ranch is all about Families.  After All, There is nothing more important to you than your family, and it’s the memories of your family that you always go back to when needed.  If you are like us and believe this is a worthwhile venture and opportunity for the community,  HELP!  Donate to the Cause and spread the word.  Forward this information via email, facebook, twitter, etc. to as many contacts that you can.

story:
Our Story

Laura Short and Krystin Tschacher Leonhardt, two organizers from The World Wide Anti Whaling protestors, are asking for your help to keep awareness world's eye on Taiji. We are driven by our love for our oceans and the respect of the animals within. This January 2011, we are heading to Taiji, Japan to document and try to stop the inhumane killing of whales and dolphins. We hope to be there from January 2-12. But we need your help! We are seeking donations to help fund our trip. It's not a nice trip and certainly won't be a vacation. We are a team of 2 who are dedicated to around the clock observation and documentation of the events that will take place at the cove. 

The Impact

Why do you care?

You care because this is our only Earth. And these are our only animals. We are supposed to take care of them as they take care of us. We aren't supposed to murder them. They give us so much beauty and wonder. They give us a look at the areas we aren't meant to go into naturally-our oceans. Dolphins and whales are like us in so many ways. They live in pods, they have an advanced language, and they understand death. Cetaceans play an important role in maintaining ecosystem health and fisheries. Dolphins - like many other high-level predators, prey mainly on old and ill fish. This way they are playing an important role in fighting infectious diseases among fish populations and ensure the reproduction of fisheries resources. It has been proved in many studies that the elimination of top predators in marine systems has negative, cascading effects for the entire ecosystem. By killing dolphins, we are killing the sanitary police of the oceans, which may result in more diseases and diminished fish populations. To kill a dolphin, therefore, means to directly damage sustainable fisheries.

What We Need & What You Get

We are paying for most of this out of our own pockets. We don't have to go but with the proven continued presence of other organizations in Taiji, the count of dolphin and whale killings hasn't reached triple digits yet. The fishermen plan to kill close to 2,000 by April. With your help, we can prevent them from reaching that goal. We can keep pregnant dolphins alive! We can keep babies from being orphaned. We can keep families together. And we can fight the almighty Yen.

What do you get? 

You will receiver postcards from Taiji. You will also receive photos and video of the events. We will be documenting everything! We hope to be there for 10 days. That's a lot of footage and photographs. You will also receive a rubber bracelet with our initials, WWAWD. Your name will also go in a section on our website as a way to say thank you for helping to support our trip. Because without you, we wouldn't be able to go. So you deserve some recognition as well!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There is another way you can help if you do not feel comfortable donating money. We've set up a store with T-shirts that you can purchase from. We wanted to keep the price pretty reasonable so we've only raised the base price by $1.00. Yes only $1.00. For each item sold, the WWAWD receives only $1.00. You can view our store at http://printfection.com/worldwideantiwhalingday

 

 You can also view our website at www.wwawd.org

 

Thank you so much for your time and we hope to make this trip!

story:
Our Story & Mission

The importance of MystiCat Cafe is to create a zen-like sanctuary for cats where they are constantly surrounded by love and attention.  This is more than a cool place to hang out. We want to connect humans and cats together to create a unique bond. We will be the official adoption center for Krazy for Kats, Inc., a 501 C3 Non Profit Cat Rescue Group.  
 

MystiCat Cafe will be Dedicated to Helping Cats & Kittens with "Special Needs." 
 

Everyone loves the cute kittens and fluffy adults, but what about the ones that have been abandoned on the streets and are starving, injured or born with a deformity that adds to their constant struggle to stay alive. 

These are the cats that are usually overlooked for adoption after being dumped in the shelter.  The frightened souls that are euthanized because they are different or need a little extra care. 

THESE ARE OUR MYSTICATS!  

At our unique Cat Cafe, we will cater to the tri-pawds - the kitties that had their front or back leg amputated. We will take in the special ones that are deaf or blind, missing an eye, ear or a tail, and most importantly, we will provide a safe sanctuary for our super seniors! We believe ALL cats are beautiful, spiritual souls that deserve our love and care.  

Our goal is to create a cat cafe where people can grab their favorite drinks then head over to the mystical cat den where you will be greeted by our furry friends.  We will commission artwork from famous cat artists such a Jeff Haynie and play beautiful music for the animal lovers soul by Marco Missinato to highlight the importance of being in balance with animals on our planet.

PLUS we will offer specialty classes on Animal Communication, Reiki, Tarot Readings, Cat Behavior, Guided Meditation, Yoga with world-renowned instructors and much, much more!

 

About our Founder, Michele Guzy

                                         

Born and raised in Anchorage, Alaska, Michele was always around animals and nature. Dreaming of being a veterinarian since a young age, her connection with animals and her passion to work with them never left. Arriving in Los Angeles at the age of 19, Michele was in shock at the outrageous amount of homeless cats living on the streets.

Though she chose a different career path in behavioral counseling, she never strayed away from her love of working with animals. Volunteering her time in Africa, Michele has worked with lions and cheetahs in rehabilitating centers so they can continue living a life out in the wild. 

Michele lives her life dedicated to the welfare of the animals and started a 501 C3 Non-Profit called Krazy for Kats, Inc.  For the past 13 years, she has been rescuing cats off the streets of L.A and providing them a safe place in her house to live before adopting them out to their fur-ever homes. 

Looking for a better solution than to hold adoption events with cats in cages, Michele has formed MystiCat Cafe - a free-roaming adoption center for cats and kittens.  This is the best way for people to come in and actually hang out with all of the cats and be able to pet them.  This is the best way to get to know their personality and how they interact with others, especially before adoption.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How It Will Work

The well-being of the cats is very important to us.  We will be working with FixNation, local veterinarians and other animal welfare groups to save as many cats as we can each year. Our goal is to adopt 500 cats to new homes.  We will abide by all health and safety codes for our desired location and we will have an age limit for our younger guests.  

To visit MystiCat Cafe, we request that you make your reservation in advance (tax deductible)  to hang out with the kitties!  Our unique space allows us to have 15 to 20 cats at one time so there will be a limited number of people allowed in the cat den to make sure our felines are feeling comfortable.  

All of the MystiCats will be available for adoption through Krazy for Kats, Inc. and your tax deductible adoption fee will go right back into our  mission to save more kitties from our L.A. streets and shelters.  

Feel free to grab a cup of FREE coffee or tea from one of our local vendors and don't forget your CAMERA!  Our kitties are master Photo-Bombers so be careful!  You may get some kitty surprises with each shot!

Health Benefits of Being Around Cats

According to research done by FutureMedica, when you think of things that can help you increase your health, you do not often think about pets. Health professionals and researchers are finding that connecting with cats can actually benefit your health and well being!

  • Lower risk of cardiovascular disease.
  • Reduce risk of heart attack.
  • Improve your immune function.
  • Help prevent asthma in children.
  • Reduce blood pressure.
  • Lower cholesterol.
  • Reduce risk of stroke.
  • Reduce stress.
  • Reduce anxiety.
  • Improve your mood.
  • Help with depression.
  • Help with autism.
  • Reduce loneliness.
  • Fewer health care visits.
  • Longer life.
     

What We Need & What You Get

Our mission could not be possible without YOU! Tackling issues such as homelessness within the cat population is not an easy task, and neither is creating a cafe experience with animals. We want to create a separate place for coffee and snacks, and a safe space for interactions and bonding with the cats.

Your contribution to our project is  100% of the tax-deductible and will go towards developing the center and providing food, supplies and medical care for all of the cats in our care. Funds will also help pay for licenses, permits and the build-out of the space.  To open a Cat Cafe, we need to make sure we are compliant with the health department and city codes.  Every contribution is a step towards creating this experience.

Help us combat the homelessness of cats in Los Angeles and enjoy our many PERKS with your TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution to the MystiCat Cafe TODAY!

The Impact

The welfare of animals in Los Angeles is in need of change. Unfortunately, millions of cats can be found scattered around the streets of LA, without the basic necessities of food, water, and shelter. The cat population is constantly growing, leaving even more cats vulnerable. By creating a safe place, such as our cafe, we are taking a step in the right direction by providing shelter, spreading awareness of animal welfare, and most importantly, providing love for cats. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please help us spread the word with social media and your personal/professional connections. This is an important issue, and we can work together in providing cats with shelter and safety.  

  • Like us on FaceBook
  • Follow us on Instagram
  • Share our Indiegogo Link! 
     

THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS 
TAX DEDUCTIBLE CONTRIBUTION!
story_txt:
Our Story & Mission
The importance of MystiCat Cafe is to create a zen-like sanctuary for cats where they are constantly surrounded by love and attention.  This is more than a cool place to hang out. We want to connect humans and cats together to create a unique bond. We will be the official adoption center for Krazy for Kats, Inc., a 501 C3 Non Profit Cat Rescue Group.   

MystiCat Cafe will be Dedicated to Helping Cats & Kittens with "Special Needs."  

Everyone loves the cute kittens and fluffy adults, but what about the ones that have been abandoned on the streets and are starving, injured or born with a deformity that adds to their constant struggle to stay alive. 
These are the cats that are usually overlooked for adoption after being dumped in the shelter.  The frightened souls that are euthanized because they are different or need a little extra care. 
THESE ARE OUR MYSTICATS!  At our unique Cat Cafe, we will cater to the tri-pawds - the kitties that had their front or back leg amputated. We will take in the special ones that are deaf or blind, missing an eye, ear or a tail, and most importantly, we will provide a safe sanctuary for our super seniors! We believe ALL cats are beautiful, spiritual souls that deserve our love and care.  
Our goal is to create a cat cafe where people can grab their favorite drinks then head over to the mystical cat den where you will be greeted by our furry friends.  We will commission artwork from famous cat artists such a Jeff Haynie and play beautiful music for the animal lovers soul by Marco Missinato to highlight the importance of being in balance with animals on our planet.
PLUS we will offer specialty classes on Animal Communication, Reiki, Tarot Readings, Cat Behavior, Guided Meditation, Yoga with world-renowned instructors and much, much more!
 
About our Founder, Michele Guzy
                                         
Born and raised in Anchorage, Alaska, Michele was always around animals and nature. Dreaming of being a veterinarian since a young age, her connection with animals and her passion to work with them never left. Arriving in Los Angeles at the age of 19, Michele was in shock at the outrageous amount of homeless cats living on the streets.
Though she chose a different career path in behavioral counseling, she never strayed away from her love of working with animals. Volunteering her time in Africa, Michele has worked with lions and cheetahs in rehabilitating centers so they can continue living a life out in the wild. 
Michele lives her life dedicated to the welfare of the animals and started a 501 C3 Non-Profit called Krazy for Kats, Inc.  For the past 13 years, she has been rescuing cats off the streets of L.A and providing them a safe place in her house to live before adopting them out to their fur-ever homes. 
Looking for a better solution than to hold adoption events with cats in cages, Michele has formed MystiCat Cafe - a free-roaming adoption center for cats and kittens.  This is the best way for people to come in and actually hang out with all of the cats and be able to pet them.  This is the best way to get to know their personality and how they interact with others, especially before adoption.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
How It Will Work
The well-being of the cats is very important to us.  We will be working with FixNation, local veterinarians and other animal welfare groups to save as many cats as we can each year. Our goal is to adopt 500 cats to new homes.  We will abide by all health and safety codes for our desired location and we will have an age limit for our younger guests.  
To visit MystiCat Cafe, we request that you make your reservation in advance (tax deductible)  to hang out with the kitties!  Our unique space allows us to have 15 to 20 cats at one time so there will be a limited number of people allowed in the cat den to make sure our felines are feeling comfortable.  
All of the MystiCats will be available for adoption through Krazy for Kats, Inc. and your tax deductible adoption fee will go right back into our  mission to save more kitties from our L.A. streets and shelters.  
Feel free to grab a cup of FREE coffee or tea from one of our local vendors and don't forget your CAMERA!  Our kitties are master Photo-Bombers so be careful!  You may get some kitty surprises with each shot!

Health Benefits of Being Around Cats
According to research done by FutureMedica, when you think of things that can help you increase your health, you do not often think about pets. Health professionals and researchers are finding that connecting with cats can actually benefit your health and well being!

Lower risk of cardiovascular disease.
Reduce risk of heart attack.
Improve your immune function.
Help prevent asthma in children.
Reduce blood pressure.
Lower cholesterol.
Reduce risk of stroke.
Reduce stress.
Reduce anxiety.
Improve your mood.
Help with depression.
Help with autism.
Reduce loneliness.
Fewer health care visits.

Longer life. 

What We Need & What You Get
Our mission could not be possible without YOU! Tackling issues such as homelessness within the cat population is not an easy task, and neither is creating a cafe experience with animals. We want to create a separate place for coffee and snacks, and a safe space for interactions and bonding with the cats.
Your contribution to our project is  100% of the tax-deductible and will go towards developing the center and providing food, supplies and medical care for all of the cats in our care. Funds will also help pay for licenses, permits and the build-out of the space.  To open a Cat Cafe, we need to make sure we are compliant with the health department and city codes.  Every contribution is a step towards creating this experience.
Help us combat the homelessness of cats in Los Angeles and enjoy our many PERKS with your TAX DEDUCTIBLE contribution to the MystiCat Cafe TODAY!

The Impact

The welfare of animals in Los Angeles is in need of change. Unfortunately, millions of cats can be found scattered around the streets of LA, without the basic necessities of food, water, and shelter. The cat population is constantly growing, leaving even more cats vulnerable. By creating a safe place, such as our cafe, we are taking a step in the right direction by providing shelter, spreading awareness of animal welfare, and most importantly, providing love for cats. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute financially, please help us spread the word with social media and your personal/professional connections. This is an important issue, and we can work together in providing cats with shelter and safety.  

Like us on FaceBook
Follow us on Instagram
Share our Indiegogo Link!  


THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS TAX DEDUCTIBLE CONTRIBUTION!

story:
Our Story 

Founded by the vivacious Gina Elise, Pin-Ups For Vets raises funds to improve Veterans' healthcare, donates funds to VA hospitals for medical equipment and program expansion, improves quality of life for ill Veterans across the United States through personal bedside visits to deliver gifts and show appreciation, promotes volunteerism at Veterans Hospitals, conducts morale-boosting events for military spouses, and boosts morale for deployed troops through delivery of care packages. 

This special project, beloved by Veterans and the troops worldwide, has earned several community service awards and has been reported on in radio, television, and in print media.  The troops have flown 9 American flags over military bases to honor the work of this charity.  In addition, the organization has been honored by Oprah Winfrey and recognized by Congress. 



How can you help? 

Pin-Ups for vets is asking for your help to get your Seattle Chapter the funds they needs to get started on the right foot!

Here is what can be accomplished at each fundraising milestone!

$3500
  • Production Costs of Seattle Chapter Official Pin-Ups for Vets Posters that the girls can deliver and sign for our Troops - these personal gifts from the girls they meet mean so much to our veterans!  
  • 100 Calendars to deliver as gifts of appreciation to our hospitalized Veterans
  • administrative costs including airfare for National Pin-Ups for Vets Ambassador, food per day & ground transportation
$5,000
  • All of the above
  •  $1500 in equipment donation to Seattle Area VA Hospital 
$10,000
  • All of the above  
  •  $3,000 Equipment donation 
  •  A Pin-Ups for Vets WWII Style event in Seattle to Celebrate Local Chapter with our Area Supporters 


The Impact

The Pin-Ups For Vets organization is stepping up to fill the gaps in funding that will help our hospitals better care for our ill Veterans and our injured troops. Since its inception, Pin-Ups For Vets has raised and donated substantial funding to allow VA and military hospitals to purchase needed equipment for physical, occupational, and cognitive rehabilitation, as well as funding needed to expand other necessary health care programs for our Veterans.

Interesting in becoming an Official Pin-Ups for Vets Ambassador? Have a passion for supporting our Troops? Love Retro Style? Want to perform for our Veterans?

We want to hear from you! Please email Julia@pinupsforvets.com for more information on how to get involved. 

Thank you for your support and please share to help our Ambassadors bring a little joy to Seattle Area Veterans!

story:
Bring The Shire to America!


  • We are passionate fans of the Hobbit and Lord of the Rings. Help us in this ambitious adventure to create the amazing world of the hobbit Shire.
  • The existing set that was used for the films is located in North New Zealand, which can be daunting for some fans on the other side of the planet to visit. The goal of this project is to create this amazing community in America and allow millions of fans to visit The Shire in the Western Hemisphere. 
  • We will build the Shire in Middle Tennessee on the outskirts of The Great Smoky Mountains. It has the closest resembling landscape to that of the one built in New Zealand and described in the fictional works.
  • The funding of this project would be monumental by allowing so many people to escape to a stunning and beautiful land they might not get the chance to see in New Zealand. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for a total of 7.3 million dollars to create The Shire in Middle Tennessee. 
  • 1.6 million will be allocated for the purchase of land as well as landscaping to create the unique look of The Shire.
  • 4.3 million will be used for labor, construction, and materials to build multiple hobbit holes, the Dragon Inn, The Mill, and Double Bridge.
  • 1.4 million will be for maintenance, public service, livestock facilities, & administration costs for future preservation of The Shire.
  • We have awesome perks ranging from having your name inscribed in elvish in the Dragon Inn Banquet Hall all the way to a week's stay in an exclusive hobbit hole and full party thrown in your name!
  • Donations: please donate within your means. This project is to create something fun and unique for everyone to enjoy!

The Impact

  • This gives the opportunity to create a unique attraction in Tennessee that has a broad range of appeal and a large fan base. Imagine the feeling of being able to walk through the hobbit holes and feel what it is like to live in that fantasy world. This will be built on a large piece of land that will escape any views of the modern world. 

The Shire Festival

  • We are also aiming to create a yearly arts and music festival. Our goal would be to produce a week long festival with plenty of space for camping, crafts, and musical acts. Imagine seeing music royalty rocking out with you in The Shire!! We hope to join in and create an experience that competes with famous festivals like Bonaroo, Coachella, and Lollapalooza.

How it will start

  • We have a large local community of contractors, builders, landscapers, craftsmen, and Lord of the Rings fans ready to jump into action to help in this venture.
  • Construction would begin in 2016 and look to have the gates open for the public in 2018.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us!

  • Please get the word out using your social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram) to let as many people know about this campaign! There are built in tools here on Indiegogo that will help you do just that!

Follow us on Twitter @TheShireAmerica or drop us a line at theshireamerica@gmail.com


Thank you for taking the time to take a look at our campaign. This project holds near and dear to our hearts and would love to make this dream come true.

story:
My Name is John Jensen.  Many people call me the rev, it's a ironic nick name as I am a pastor, but... I am not very reverendy.  I have a wonderful wife of almost 25 years, who has put up with my crap and loved me in spite of it, and two talented daughters who are finding their own way to follow their passions and creative spirit.  I am the oldest son of five boys, and that is where my normal life ends. 

When I was a very young toddler my mother got tired of me running out of the door.  She got a stern tone and said, "don't you dare put one foot out of that door.  I didn't hesitate and jumped right out of the door.  She yelled, "what did I tell you?" and I pointed at my feet and said, "two feet" I have been jumping in with both feet, and looking for ways around the rules ever since.

In my life I have been a portugese bullfighter, a construction worker, a repo man, a bouncer, a professional cage fighter, a msssionary, I owned my own martial arts school, was a partner in a mural painting company, and my own paintings are hanging in collections internationally. One of my greatest honors was to have my paintings on display next to those of Carlos Estrada-Vega, Thomas Pathe and Fr. Bill Moore.

I see pipe making as the continuation of my creative impulse.  To be able to make what I see, and then share that with others, to take the incredible natural beauty of wood and make it not only a sculpture, but a sculpture that can be a part of peoples relaxation and personal expression. This just seems like good work to me. 

Basically without your help, I am trying to learn in the dark.  Your help can literallyd determine if I can make this business work, or not!  If you want to see small, sustainable businesses started, please consider helping me.

What We Need & What You Get


Well, I need $2,500.00 to pay for plane fare, hotel fees, food and the course with its materials.  Any amount over the goal will be put right into the business, buying tools and materials, and if we fail to reach the goal I will place the money in a special fund hoping to add to it to go at a later date.

I will be offering wood sculptures, pipe accesories, discounts on pipes and pipes themselves for those of you who can give towards reaching my goal.

I have been starting small businesses, small churches or various projects for years.  I know your money is hard earned, but if you support me in this I promise it will be going to a good cause.  I will work hard, creatively and passionately at this business.  I will be in my community more, and this will allow me to spend more time with people that need help, or just a friend.  Trying to juggle work, a side business, our ministry and social work, and still be a good husband and father is a bit difficult as you may imagine. You can help me consolidate these endeavours.

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't give?  I get that, if I had extra money I wouldn't need to do this campaign.  But if you could share this with your facebook friends, your twitter followers, your google+, any of your social networking or even emailing it to friends that might be interested.  The more people that see this, the more likely we will meet or exceed our goal.
 
Thank you so much
 
And thanks to Vermont freehand, for supplying materials to make perks, and Stella Angelico for letting us use her amazing music in our video

story:
Update: thank you for your help, unfortunately the money that I've received has gone towards repairs on the car that would allow me to get to Arkansas. It was completely unforseeable. I'm sorry.

 

I need your help.

In sept of 2012 my house was sold, being that I have no family in the area and nowhere else to go a friend of mine allowed me to move in with him. What he neglected to tell me was that his house was infested with roaches and fleas. I had terminex out, and it did nothing. If you look at some of the pictures you'll see what I mean.

 

The roach traps get changed daily.

The problem was that I could only afford one payment to the exterminator and that's not the end of the problem. I wake up daily to dead roaches lay all around me. I'm eating food out of a can for my own safety, my friend has no desire to fix the situation at all, and honestly he really doesn't care. Like I've mentioned I don't know anyone in the area so I've no place else to go.

I work, but the job pays little and the hours are crap. I'm only doing this because I need to move desperately. My on family won't take me in because they can't afford me and don't have the room.

Moving to Arkansas

This is the only option I have at this point, as you can see this was funded but the money immediately went to a tragic circumstance. I had to fix the car that was supposed to take me down there. The total sum of the repairs chewed up the donations and more.

My friend is becoming more and more increasingly abusive to me in nature, and is beginning to steal from me. Charging my cards (not my paypal but the card I use for direct deposit to my bank) for things. Thinking I don't notice it, he's nearly gotten into it with me physically, the situation is just getting worse and I have nowhere else to go.

Please help me.

I'm not asking for a whole lot, I'm just asking for enough gas to get to Arkansas, because that's the only option I have. I have a safe place there to stay.

My health is daily compromised, I can't use the bathroom and I can't take a shower, I've resorted to going to local YMCA's and using my friends gram's shower but she doesn't appreciate it happening all the time.

I'm essentially homeless, living in a condemned building. If you could take the time to read, or donate or signal boost this please do. I am very desperate. Each day I have no idea what's going to happen next, every day I could be on the street because of my friend.

Thank you for reading.

story:
Short Summary

HI! I'm Adrian Paul.  You might remember me from Highlander?  As soon as Highlander finished I started a charity called 'The PEACE Fund' - PEACE stands for Protect Educate and Aid Children Everywhere. I'm passionate about kids and doing what I can to help them.

This campaign is a celebrity soccer match being held on Sunday May 5th.  Join some of Combat Radio's best veteran/celebrity guests, (from Highlander, Spartacus, Breaking Bad, Mad Men, True Blood, Weeds etc...) members of the women's Pro-Am team 'BLUE HEAT' and the Combat Radio sponsored 'Deportivo Colima' for a LEGENDARY Cinco De Mayo soccer event....ENTERTAINMENT/HILARITY GUARANTEED!

How can you be a part of this great event and also know that your contribution is going to children in need?  I intend to win this match - (yep - Duncan MacLeod's determination and passion for winning wan't all his idea! LOL...)  That means that my team is going to score more goals than our opponents.

WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:

Your part in this?  Sponsor me for taking part in this great event.

The Impact

Your sponsorship is going to make a real difference.  We are going to use the money to buy an Infant Respirator for a hospital in Hungary.  Sure - $5 on its own won't do that much but when joined with all the other $$ amounts, the difference is that a baby in distress is going to live and laugh and hopefully make a positive difference in the world - all because you reached out and supported me.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by sponsoring our goals, maybe you can help by spreading the word and sharing this URL on other lists, Boards and on other social media sites?  Let your family and friends know.  Maybe it could be your birthday gift instead of another toaster (LOL!)...

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

There can be only one....soccer match.  One winner....children in need.

Peace

Adrian Paul
story_txt:
Short Summary
HI! I'm Adrian Paul.  You might remember me from Highlander?  As soon as Highlander finished I started a charity called 'The PEACE Fund' - PEACE stands for Protect Educate and Aid Children Everywhere. I'm passionate about kids and doing what I can to help them.
This campaign is a celebrity soccer match being held on Sunday May 5th.  Join some of Combat Radio's best veteran/celebrity guests, (from Highlander, Spartacus, Breaking Bad, Mad Men, True Blood, Weeds etc...) members of the women's Pro-Am team 'BLUE HEAT' and the Combat Radio sponsored 'Deportivo Colima' for a LEGENDARY Cinco De Mayo soccer event....ENTERTAINMENT/HILARITY GUARANTEED!
How can you be a part of this great event and also know that your contribution is going to children in need?  I intend to win this match - (yep - Duncan MacLeod's determination and passion for winning wan't all his idea! LOL...)  That means that my team is going to score more goals than our opponents.
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:
Your part in this?  Sponsor me for taking part in this great event.


The Impact
Your sponsorship is going to make a real difference.  We are going to use the money to buy an Infant Respirator for a hospital in Hungary.  Sure - $5 on its own won't do that much but when joined with all the other $$ amounts, the difference is that a baby in distress is going to live and laugh and hopefully make a positive difference in the world - all because you reached out and supported me.  


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help by sponsoring our goals, maybe you can help by spreading the word and sharing this URL on other lists, Boards and on other social media sites?  Let your family and friends know.  Maybe it could be your birthday gift instead of another toaster (LOL!)...
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
There can be only one....soccer match.  One winner....children in need.
Peace
Adrian Paul

story:
My name is Frieda and I am an artist, with a vagina, in Los Angeles. 

Even though my own reproductive organs are nearing their expiration date I believe in a woman’s right to make medical decisions without government interference. When the men of SCOTUS made their latest decisions that affect women’s reproductive rights I became enraged. This country is gun crazy and vaginaphobic. How is it that a person can freely walk into their local restaurant with an AK over their shoulder but a woman can’t walk up to their affordable gynecologist without being verbally assaulted by anti-choice morons?  It’s madness.

I have had this image, "More Controlled Than", in mind for while and I can no longer keep it to myself.  At Skylight Books, in Los Feliz, I had Jenn Witte draw this image on the wall of one of our display windows. She posted it on her Tumblr, Jennwitte.tumblr, and got 60,000+ hits and reposts! Apparently, there’s an opportunity here to get this image out there and do some good in the process.

Your financial contribution will allow me to have t-shirts made to sell for $25.  My initial print run is modest: $1000. A portion of the proceeds from each sale will go to women’s health clinics in the Los Angeles area.  Your reposts and link sharing will help get the word out.  If this works out I plan to continue with a series of t-shirts and posters.

Any contribution is wonderful but a contribution of $30 or more will earn you one of these damn shirts and covers the cost of shipping it to you!

story:
What is SharePointalooza?

SharePointalooza is going to be an awesome 2 day technology conference in Branson, MO on Sept 12th and 13th. This conference is bringing together some of the best SharePoint and Office 365  minds in the world to a part of the country that rarely gets to experience these types of events.

We need your support to help close out funding for our event which is just weeks away! With your support we can continue to bring events like these to areas that previously do not get the chance to experience a premium technology conference at extremely affordable costs for the attendees. 

SharePointalooza is a not-for-profit event. Every little bit counts, and any extra money received will be used to make the conference even better. 

It's going to be a great time and we hope you can make it out to Branson to see us!

Thanks for stopping by and thanks for your support!

To find out more about SharePointalooza visit http://www.sharepointalooza.org 

Why donate?

Bringing a technology conference to a smaller city is always a difficult chore. Sponsors are less likely to support these events because they typically do not have local offices in the area or they feel the attendance might not be large enough to justify the expense.

This is the fourth conference we've put together and by far the largest. We have a loyal group of attendees that appreciate this area of the country being served and with the help of this IndieGoGo project we can ensure that all are expenses are paid and it will make future events possible.

We actually need more than the stated goal, but the $1,500 will ensure some of the final necessities are covered.

story:
What is Project Uplift!?!

  •  Project Uplift is  a campaign to raise awareness about sexual assault, & to empower the women who have survived these experiences! We have created a calendar showing survivors doing things they love! All proceeds will go to the Blue Bench, who provides assistance to individuals living through abuse.

    What We Need

     We need YOU to get the word out! Survivors of sexual abuse should not hide in the shadows, or be filled with shame! 1 in 5 women will be sexually assaulted, and that's that only 40% of sexual assaults are reported. Only 3% of rapists will even see a day in jail. Please purchase a calendar, the money will help survivors find the help and treatment they need to live fulfilling lives.

    The Impact

     Project Uplift wants survivors to see that individuals just like them have gone through the same thing as they have and SURVIVED. You are NOT alone, and your sexual assault does not have to define you. We as a society need to realize what an impact being sexually assaulted has on the individuals that have to go through these tragedies. Survivors need resources to help them cope with and overcome the abuse they have faced in their life. The Blue Bench offers therapy and resources for survivors, and only takes donations!


A Sneak Peek at Uplifts Calendar!

Cieara, Candace, & Morgan together for January!

Candace, who is the months of March & August!

Cieara, who is the months of April & September!

Chani, who is the months of February and October

 

Morgan, who is the months of May & July!

  Sue, who is the months of June & November!

Cieara, Chani, Candace, Morgan & Sue together for December!

Speaking up is difficult, and the women of Project Uplift are here to be your voice!

Are you a survivor yourself, but keep what happened to you buried deep down inside? Let the women of Uplift be your voice. Know that you are not alone, and no matter the circumstances this is not your fault. Know that you are a brave individual, and there is no shame in being a survivor. Be proud of the person you are, someone who is able to live day to day even with this weight on your shoulder. The women of Uplift are just like you, and we promise to make a difference, for you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Tell everyone you know about Uplift, join us in becoming Uplifted!

A special thanks to:

DeAnna Trevizo of Drive the Image & her sidekick Kenneth Hamblin

Cluster Studios of Denver

story:
Who Are We and What Are We doing?

Colby Smith and Diana Osberg will volunteer their time and skills as voyage crew to assist disabled sailors on a 12-day sailing voyage on the tall ship Tenacious from Seville to Valencia, Spain.

Tenacious is a 65-meter long wooden barque owned by the Jubilee Sailing Trust (JST).  The JST is a registered charity in Southampton, England.  Since 1978, the organization has provided tall ship sailing opportunities around the world for able-bodied and disabled sailors to sail on the open sea side by side as equals.

Diana and Colby are seasoned tall ship sailing volunteers with the non-profit organization Los Angeles Maritime Institute (LAMI) Topsail Youth Program.  We view our voyage in Spain on the tall ship Tenacious as an opportunity to reach hands across the water to connect globally and expand our arena of giving.  We are proud to be active LAMI volunteers and love to share our sailing skills.

Colby has been volunteering with the Los Angeles Maritime Institute (LAMI) over 7 years.  As one of the key sail trainers and volunteers, he works in many capacities including Youth Crew Director.  In March 2014, he guest crewed for three weeks with the tall ship Pride of Baltimore to assist with the spring up-rigging and plans to return to the Pride of Baltimore in August as relief crew for another two weeks.  "As a volunteer, I love to see the smile of pride on a person's face as they discover their own strengths never before aware of... priceless!"

This will be Diana’s second voyage on Tenacious.  In December of 2011, she sailed in the Canary Islands on Tenacious where she celebrated Christmas with her new-found sailing family (SEE A Tenacious Christmas).  She has been a sailing program volunteer with LAMI for over 7 years.  She’s also a long-time program volunteer and board member with the non-profit Dusty’s Riders.  Diana writes about her travels around the globe in her Mia Terra Blog.  She’ll publish her stories about the Tenacious Seville to Valencia voyage after she returns in March 2015.

How Can You Help?

Please help Diana and Colby cover the cost of travel and fees for a 12-day sailing voyage on the tall ship Tenacious from Seville to Valencia, Spain March 5-16, 2015.

Here is the cost breakdown:

Voyage Fees: $3800

Airfare: $3000

Hotel (before and after voyage): $500

Meals off Ship: $200

================

Total: $7500


How Does This Help?

Tenacious, along with her sister ship Lord Nelson, were designed and built by the Jubilee Sailing Trust (JST) to accommodate sailors with a broad range of disabilities, including those in wheelchairs.  Both ships use a buddy system to pair up able-bodied sailors and those with physical disabilities so they can work together to sail the vessels.  They’re the only ships in the world that do this.

Through their many years in operation, JST has learned that sailing facilitates rehabilitation and promotes education and a broader understanding of people with disabilities.  The program has changed lives and attitudes across the water and around the world.


    Risks & Challenges

    This is not a luxury cruise.  It's a sailing voyage.  Sailing is hard work and there are real dangers involved on the ocean, as well as on the ship.  Colby and Diana are trained and experienced in ship safety procedures and practices and can help to guide crew to safety should an emergency situation arise.

    As voyage crew, we'll be paired up with disabled sailors to work side by side throughout the voyage dealing with all aspects of running the ship, including helping to prepare and serve meals, washing dishes and cleaning the ship.  We will be assigned to watch groups and will be on a watch schedule while we're under sail. The watch group is responsible for monitoring ship and environmental conditions. And of course, we will set and strike sails and manage dock lines.  We will also assist disabled sailors who want to climb the rigging.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      We are truly grateful for your assistance and thank you for anything you can do to help us achieve our goal.  Please spread the word to your family, friends and colleagues.

      By the way, you don't have to be an experienced sailor to join one of these voyages. For more information on the program and how you can get involved, please visit the JST website.

story:
What's this all about?

  • We're a small group of young adults who hang out/grow/serve together at The Meeting House (Robin Drive Home Church). The Meeting House (along with Mennonite Central Committee) regularly supports community-building projects in southern Africa. Every year we collect funds and items for what we call 'AIDS CARE Kits', which home-based care workers will use to bring comfort to people living with HIV/AIDS.  We also collect 'AIDS CARE Cards', which are monetary donations that contribute to community projects in 6 countries in southern Africa.
  • Between now and March 7th, we're aiming to raise a modest $500 to put towards this year's AIDS Care efforts.

The Goal & Rationale

  • $500 will pay for all the necessary components of 3 Kits + 2 Cards.
  • As a small group of 20-somethings, mostly in school or just getting started in our jobs, it's not easy for us to generate the funds on our own. What we CAN do, however, is put our creative skills to use and return the favour for your support with some fun perks. Check out the list!

The Impact

  • Any contribution you make goes a long way, literally. Funds will be directly used to purchase products for care kits and accompanying care cards, all of which will be delivered straight to local care providers in Mozambique, Zimbabwe, and other southern African communities where care kits have been requested.

Are the Kits an effective way of helping?

  • Kits always go to organizations that specifically request them. They're a small part of sustainable development practice that connects resources to grassroots organizations who know the needs on the ground and understand the context in which the Kits will be used.
  • Some items associated with an AIDS Care Kit are purchased in Africa. The $100 that accompanies each AIDS Care Kit goes to purchase various items in-country such as medicine, vitamins, food supplements, etc. The money also goes for training of home based care workers and for transport money for clinic visits. In addition, $10 per Kit are allotted to assist with the in-country distribution costs, as many partners are located in rural, remote areas where some supplies are not readily available.

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Spreading the word is a simple, cost-free way to support if you're not in a position to give funds. The 'share' links on this page are an easy way to let folks in your network know what we're doing. Tell a few friends or colleagues about the cause!
  2. Pray!.. for the individuals and families that this is all intended to serve; that our support would have an impact; that locals serving in these communities would continue building strategies to combat poverty and disease.
  3. Donate a small item or two from the Care Kit checklist. E.g.) bar of soap, toothbrush (Our checklist is here: http://bit.ly/16iS0RD).

And that's it. Wow, thanks for reading this whole blurb! Bless you, friends.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Vinnis. I am a divorced single father raising two teen age girls. Until 2005 I was a Mainframe Software Consultant. I was making decent money and was able to provide a comfortable life for my two girls. Then suddenly the company that I was working for off-shored my entire department, and I found myself out of work.It was not until 2008 that I found another IT job.

Those were three of the most humbling years of my life. One day the ice cream truck came down our street. And I found myself unable to afford a frozen treat for my daughters on a hot summer day. That was devastating. So I went to the local ice cream truck franchise and asked for a job. I was hired on the spot. They leased me a van full of frozen novelties and assigned me a neighborhood. By the end of the day, I had sold a little over $300 worth of Ice cream bars and my commission was $120. 

$120 off of $300 worth of sales. Wow, that blew my mind. A month later I was at an auction and purchased a van that I painted to look like a brick wall. I found a company that sold me frozen novelties and I was in business. But, I didn't just sell, ice cream. I sold hot dogs, chili dogs, nachos, polish sausage, sometimes barbecue ribs and hot wings. I was a food truck before the food truck craze began.

After working an IT position for two years from 2008 - 2010, I find myself under-employed once again.Yet, I was able to save enough money to purchase a large shuttle bus that I intend on converting into a food truck. And with your help, I will create the most unique food truck experience in the city of St. Louis, "The St. Louis Wall of Fame Food Truck."

  • What We Need & What You Get

With your help, we will raise $12000. This money will be used to:

  • Install two video screens on the sides of the food truck.
  • Wrap the food truck in a brick wall motif.
  • Install the mobile kitchen appliance and systems.
For your help you will receive(based on level of contribution):
  • Coupons to enjoy a meals from St. Louis Wall of Fame Food Truck.
  • A vote on Wall of Fame Nominees
  • A sandwich or meal named in your honor
  • A personalize brick on the Wall of Fame
  • A 15 second video promo on the truck's video screens.
  • An opportunity to win a designer cake or an IPad.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who are unable to make a financial, I thank you for taking time to visit my fundraising campaign. If you are still interested in helping please get the word out. Use the share tool to let your friends and family know.

story:
About Our Angel-

Mehdi Brailey was raised by the beautiful spirit that is Kimberly Brailey. As a mother she nurtured him in the art of Love and Passion for life through imagination. She was the kind of Angel who saw nothing but the best in people; making new friends, and cherishing every single moment. She lived for the day, embracing the universe and the wonderful energy that would feed her soul. She knew grace, she knew love, she knew the power of family, and what it means to take care of one another.

Kimberly Brailey celebrated her 67th Birthday with her son, and was invited into heaven just 24hrs later. Her departure was unexpected, and in turn no arrangements were previously made. However, giving his friends & loved ones an opportunity to help Mehdi during his time of need, and a chance to give an Angel her wings.

What's Needed-

All donations will help pay for the cost of Cremation, Venue Rental for the Service, and misc. expenses in order to make this chapter in his life a smooth transition.

Any other donations such as moving boxes, helping him pack, or if you care to purchase furniture or electronics that he has, would be a big help too. Not to mention visiting for a few minutes, and giving him a big hug for support.

NOTE: The goal is set to $500 which is the minimum, so that to get the lowest interest rate and you can continue donating even after it's met the goal. Below is an actual breakdown of what it costs & what is NEEDED!

Money for Basic Cremation without Urn at Mulkey Mason: $1,700

Rental for Service at American Legion Hall: $200

Minister or a Spiritual Speaker able to give Eulogy (hopefully free, but price is usually $100)

Total: $2,000

Appreciation-

Thank you so much in advance, and as soon as he's able to pay for the cremation; we will let everyone know when the ceremony will take place should you choose to attend. Please feel free to pass this message along to anyone you know who would love to help. Thank You!

story:
Who, What & Why

Hi! I'm Tyce Light, and welcome to Bongo & Blanket's Bakehouse. We are a dog "barkery" based in Montpelier Vermont dedicated to producing wheat-, corn-, and soy-free dog biscuits. (Well, when I say "we" I really mean just me along with the generous help of a friend or two when needed. Did I mention I'm really grateful for their help?) Bongo & Blanket's Bakehouse biscuits are made with love, really good stuff, no bad stuff, and even more love. They help build the bond between dogs and their humans, one tail wag at a time. Our next project is getting these tasty biscuits into more stores for Christmas, and for that, we could really use a cookie dough depositor; it would allow moving production out of the home kitchen and into a dedicated commercial kitchen space. This is where YOU can help.

I need to raise $2500 to cover the cost of a Rhodes Kook-E-King Manual Counter Top Cookie Dough Depositor, plus shipping and insurance, or I will not be able to keep up with production as currently each biscuit is cut by hand with a cookie cutter. So I'm turning to my strongest supporters, YOU, to ask for contributions. In exchange, I'm offering really great perks, like fridge magnets (everyone loves a fridge magnet), T-shirts, and of course, dog biscuits. Your contribution will help us ramp up production with the Kook-E-King cookie dough depositor, and further, it will help spread the love that comes in each Bongo & Blanket's Bakehouse biscuit. Thank YOU!

Where Do You Come In?

In a nutshell, we're asking you to believe in what we do, and to show that by contributing to the expansion of the business. Can it be more basic than that?

Since launching to the public in March 2013, the response to Bongo & Blanket's Bakehouse has been stupendous, enormous, fantastic...in a word, superlative. Six months down the track, we've reached the point where we need money to make money.

Currently, production is out of my home kitchen; however, this is not sustainable if the business is to grow. I have the opportunity to move production to the Vermont Food Venture Center but cannot continue there with cutting each biscuit individually with a cookie cutter. Production costs would skyrocket despite the excellent set-up they have.

A cookie dough depositor would reduce what currently takes up to an hour or more of production time to just a few minutes.

What Do We Need?

  • Approximately $1400 for the purchase of a Rhodes Kook-E-King Manual Counter Top Cookie Dough Extractor.
  • Approximately $300 for additional dies. We're looking at a unit for $1700 including bone-shaped dies.
  • The additional $300 in the request will go toward shipping and insurance to deliver the unit to Vermont.
  • The additional funds in the $2500 amount sought will go a small way to covering the cost of the perks and the fees to Indiegogo and PayPal.

What's In It For You?

Apart from the great feeling you will have contributing to the success of a small business in Central Vermont, there are a number of perks outlined to the right. These include public acknowledgement of your contribution, refrigerator magnets, T-shirts (see an image in the Gallery section) and, it goes without saying, Bongo & Blanket's Bakehouse biscuits.

What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

We'd really rather not think of that! To respect the transparency of our relationship, we will use monies raised to purchase ingredients, additional labels and product bags, corrugated cardboard case boxes, and other production-related items.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've made it this far, you must be interested! :) Even if you can't contribute you can still make a huge difference. Please share our campaign with your friends and family and help us build momentum. We do have a website (check it out), and we have a well viewed, up-to-date Facebook page here. 

Here's a map showing the contributions as we receive them: http://tinyurl.com/lcq88tg.

Stop by; drop us a note. We would love to hear from you. 

With sincere thanks and gratitude,

Tyce, for Bongo & Blanket's Bakehouse

story:
LET'S INSPIRE THE WORLD TOGETHER!
Join me on this exciting expedition where I aim to travel around the world reporting inspiring stories of real life entrepreneur! I want to find out how people from all over the world overcame obstacles, reach success and how they keep pushing forward every single day of their life.
These stories will foster positive energy and are capable of inspiring people.
On this journey I will also act as a volunteer in India for a month!

JOIN ME!

What? ANDRÉ LEONARDO TOUR

Round the world tour reporting the most inspirational stories I can find to inspire entrepreneurs and other people to do more. Simultaneously I want to promote Portugal all over the world and dignify Magellan, one of the most visionary, fearless and entrepreneurs of all time.

I do it because I believe that people are tired of clichés and  pretty words but then nothing happens so I want to really travel the world and really show how entrepreneurs all over the world develop projects, how they go from point A to point B, how the face problems and always move on. Simultaneously, Magellan 500 years ago was one of the greatest entrepreneurs and of all time but the truth is that, today there’s a new generation of people, entrepreneurs and entities that are pushing Portugal forward at this difficult moment. I will meet hundreds of entrepreneurs all over the world and I want to promote Portugal as a brand and Portuguese brands.

This tour will take 9 months and I will visit 18 countries – some of them include Tanzania, Israel, Mozambique, India, Thailand, Australia, Brazil, USA or England – among others.

This mission that is, in fact, much more than a regular project or a cool adventure. This project is about a lifestyle, solutions, heroes, contributing for a better world and understanding of the entrepreneurial mindset all over the world. On this tour I will also act as volunteer in India ( SAPANA NGO) and I will also write a book – a percentage of this book will be donate to Acredita Portugal entrepreneurship and innovation non-profit association.

Who?

My name is André Leonardo and I am a 24 year old entrepreneur from Portugal.

I have been developing social projects over the years. Among others, I have organized and promoted two non-profit international entrepreneurship events in Azores for 600 people each (both sold out for the first - and second - time in Azores), brought together 24 recognized speakers including Luis Filipe Vieira (S.L.Benfica president), Garrett Mcnamarra (World Class Surfer), Michael Grove (CEO Collabworks), Luis Marques (CEO SIC) or Mário Ferreira (CEO Douro Azul), manage more than 30 people and generate thousands of Euros for social purposes. It was awesome!

Last year I have done a small entrepreneurship tour. I have done more than 30.000km, went to 12 cities in two continents and interviewed more than 70 top CEO´s, entrepreneurs and politicians. My goal was to find out how, when and why can an entrepreneur be successful in Azores and after a much extended research I went to best regions in the world in the categories that Azores were good to learn and bring some of that knowledge to Azores – I visited Silicon Valley (technology), Vaxjo (greenest city in Europe), Asturias (one of the most advanced regions in rural tourism), among others. It just went great!

I define myself as an optimist, an entrepreneur, a traveler, a Portuguese and a dreamer. I love living a bold life and talking about entrepreneurship and implementing ideas.

What you fund and what you get

I have gathered recognized endorsers and sponsors. I also have developed several small projects to help fund this project, I am taking care of all of the logistic details alone to save money, I have learned to program, basic Photoshop and web design and I actually create the project website by myself - almost no cost. I´m doing everything I can to finance this project.

I´m doing everything I can but I still need help. It is hard to depend on corporate sponsors and although I already have some, I still need your help. Money will be use to cover expenses. I would also be very happy if you can follow me on my website and social media. Maybe we can meet during me tour! I would love to have a coffee!

This is such an exciting project and I hope you can help me :)

What You Get

I believe that the greatest perk I can offer you is be part of this mission that aims to inspire the world. Be part of this positive flow and join me!
Some little things I can send you:

·  5€ I will post your photo and/or name in the mission Mosaic Photo that will be on the website and social network;

·  20€ Official supporter certificate personally sign by me!

·  60€ Official supporter certificate personally sign by me and an Official supporter T-shirt!

·  100€ Official supporter certificate personally sign by me + Official supporter T-shirt + your name will appear on a thank you video!

·  250€ Official supporter certificate personally sign by me + Official supporter T-shirt + your name will appear on a thank you video + Your name will be on the “thank you” part of the book!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help :) Please:

  • Share my Indiegogo campaign;
  • Share  my website: www.andreleonardotour.com
  • Share my Facebook: www.facebook.com/andreleonardotour
