story:
Who is iCan?

iCan is a Non-Profit organization that is dedicated to reignite the passion inside Christians to be involved in their communities again. iCan identifies different needs in the community and then brings them before local Christians to gain support.We provide Christians with the opprotunitty to serve their community under a Christian title.

The Impact?

Your contribution is helping to redefine Christianity. Statistics show that only 1 in 4 Christians in America volunteer. Along with iCan, you will help reignite that passion within Christians to become a beacon of hope in their community again. With these supplies  we are able to begin bridging that gap between communities and Christians.

Here is an example of what your donations help iCan achieve. iCan has already helped the Child Crisis Center in Mesa, AZ raise $230 in cash, much need supplies and 10 volunteers to host an event for the children. This was all achieved by linking the center with a local church in the valley.

What Your Donations Will Be Used For.*

  • Business Cards
  • Literature To Promote iCan to Churches and potential Non-Profit Partners
  • Embroidered Collared Shirts for iCan Staff.
  • Printer
  • Non-profit Quickbooks
  • Office Supplies
  • Misc Costs

Other Ways You Can Help!

Can't contribute financially? Don't worry! There are other ways to be involved!

  • Spread the word to fellow Christians. Help us to gain support from others you know can help.
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to learn more on how you and your church can be a part of iCan.
  • Pray. Without God we are nothing.

Learn More About This Organization On Our Website: www.involvedchristians.com

*We do NOT hold 501c3 tax exempt status with the IRS and CANNOT provide tax deductions to your contributions.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mukhtar Nazari and I am an inventor and innovator by choice. I have strong background in business and I am very passionate about new technologies. I am an inventor, entrepreneur, and creative thinker. I always look for ways to solve things.

ECOOTAG is an electronic Motor Vehicle Registration Tag that is controlled electronically online and through and App. As a matter of fact, ECOOTAG stands for Electronically Click On/Off Tag.

Bringing ECOOTAG to life will provide convenience, easy access to vehicle owners, and save time and money on vehicle registration unquestionably. ECOOTAG will also help our Ecosystem in a way no one has thought of. 

Together we will change the way we register our vehicles for ever.  

What We Need & What You Get

In reaching our goal to give ECOOTAG a chance at existence, we are asking for $100,000. The funds will be used solely for the creation of ECOOTAG. This batch of funds will take us to the next step which is getting the ECOOTAG to a testing stage. 

Do you want to be part of history in the making? Join us in this venture to make history together. You will be the first ones that will receive ECOOTAG as it is ready to roll. 

Regardless of how much money we raise, our goal and determination is the same. We will move on to make ECOOTAG a reality. Any amount raised will be used for that purpose. 

The Impact

Ever since the birth of Automobiles, registering and renewing vehicles registration have remained the same regardless of available technologies. We saw that same old routine of registering our cars and receiving our colored stickers to go with it. In the process, we lost many millions and possibly billions of trees to print those registration cards and stickers. ECOOTAG will do its part in helping trees be trees by eliminating the need to printing registrations cards. The world is moving faster than ever in providing humanly support to our Ecosystem and we are joining them in their cause that is ultimately everyone's cause. 

Please be part of ECOOTAG that is about to become synonymous with Ecosystem.

Other Ways You Can Help

We at ECOOTAG need your help whether its monetarily or otherwise. We welcome your talent! Please let us know how you can help us achieve our dream.  Please take out your loudspeakers and let the WORLD know by making some noise. Indiegogo is the place to be at. You can use the share tools with ease.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Know Your Roots Project

Hello to all my friends, family, kasamas and supporters.

My name is Michael Dalupo, and I own a clothing company called Know Your Roots Apparel. Our mission statement is to educate our community about our her/history culture and struggle.

So we wanted to create a space where we can execute our mission statement.

This space will be used to run workshops such as:

History

  • Learning about Philippine History
  • Filipino American History and our Contribution to America

Culture

  • Baybayin Workshops
  • Learning Tagalog
  • Hiphop Workshops
  • Cultural Dance
  • Filipino Martial Art
  • Safe space for the youth
Struggle
  • Youth and Students Issues
  • Human Trafficking
  • Workers Rights
  • Know Your Rights Training

Workshops will be run by me, community members and community organizations.

Organizations:

Anakbayan Silicon Valley

Anakbayan Silicon Valley (ABSV) is a comprehensive youth organization that seeks to unite all youth in the struggle for genuine social change and liberation of the Philippines. By educating, organizing, and mobilizing the youth in Silicon Valley, ABSV fights for the rights of Filipinos in America and advances the Philippine struggle for national democracy.

PAWIS - Pilipino Association of Workers and Immigrants

“PAWIS” translates to “sweat” and symbolizes the struggles, hardships, and sacrifices of the members to provide for the needs of our loved ones with dignity.

*In 2002, PAWIS was formed to fight against social and economic injustice faced by Filipino workers and im/migrants in Santa Clara County. Initial PAWIS members were former airport screeners, resulting from the U.S. Aviation and Transportation Security Act after 9-11-2001.

*This Act is discriminatory against Filipino workers and im/migrants. It requires airport screeners to be US citizens and that they pass a new employment and language test, which had nothing to do with the job of airport screeners.

*Today PAWIS continues to support Filipinos in Santa Clara County, the bay area, in the U.S and around the world. Many are working in industries such as health care, retail/sales, and electronic manufacturing.

NAFCON - National Alliance for Filipino Concerns

NAFCON is a national multi-issue alliance of Filipino organizations and individuals in the United States serving to protect the rights and welfare of Filipinos by fighting for social, economic, and racial justice and equality. At present, NAFCON members encompass over 23 cities in the United States.

Location:

It will be in the border of San Jose and Milpitas 

Roughly about 1680 sqft


What we need.

We need $25,000.00 to cover the lease for a whole year.
That means this will give us a whole year to raise funds for the next year of operation.
Which we will be selling Know Your Roots Apparel and a screen printing services to sustain the operation of the space.

Honestly, this will run as a non-profit space, but without the 501c paper work.
Instead of relying on a big funding from an institution, I prefer funding from the community that i want to serve. That means, we as a business would have to answer to that community.


Why we need.

With the crime rate and homicide rising around Silicon Valley, the youth needs a safe place where we can offer activities and keep them off the streets.

There's a huge Filipino population is San Jose and Silicon Valley, but not enough social services

There's a  trend in CA that the filipino community is starting to be recognized (AB 123 + Itliong-Vera Cruz Middle School + Filipino Mural Project), so it's timely that the SJ Filipino community be recognized as well with a comprehensive community space

A common place where the Filipino community can gather and come together.

A place to foster creativity and learning.

PERKS

Stickers

Your Name in Baybayin


Posters

Barong Style Shirt

The shirts says in Baybayin a pre Spaniard Philippine Script "Alamin mo ang iyong ugat" which in english say Know Your Roots.


Know Your Roots T Shirt

Know Your Roots Hoodie

Andres Bonifacio - Limited Edition 18 x 24 Canvas - Only 10 Available

Lapu Lapu - Limited Edition 18 x 24 Canvas - Only 10 Available

Jose Rizal - Limited Edition 18 x 24 Canvas - Only 10 Available

Gabriela Silang - Limited Edition 18 x 24 Canvas - Only 10 Available

Supremo Bonifacio - Limited Edition 18 x 24 Canvas - Only 10 Available

Young Boinifacio - Limited Edition 18 x 24 Canvas - Only 10 Available



How we got started:

Doing Work:

Baybayin Workshop with API Community

Comprehensive Immigration Reform Community Forum and Discussion

Anakbayan Silicon Valley Open House X Art and Propaganda and Screen Printing Workshop

AB 123 Norcal Coalition Trying to pass California's AB 123: Include school instruction on the Filipinos contribution to the farm worker movement.

Grand Opening

If we reach our goal, we plan to have a grand opening around the end of November, about 30 days after the campaign ends. 

If we dont reach our goal, whatever we raise will still be used to acquire the space. Minimum of 6,000 is needed to open which im confident we will do.

Other ways to help:

  • You can share this campaign and the video to help raise funds and publicize the campaign via social media and blogs
  • Use the hashtag #kyrproject 


If you have an questions please contact us at michaelthomas@kyrapparel.com


Thank You

Michael Dalupo

Know Your Roots!
story_txt:
Know Your Roots Project

Hello to all my friends, family, kasamas and supporters.
My name is Michael Dalupo, and I own a clothing company called Know Your Roots Apparel. Our mission statement is to educate our community about our her/history culture and struggle. 
So we wanted to create a space where we can execute our mission statement.
This space will be used to run workshops such as:
History

Learning about Philippine History
Filipino American History and our Contribution to America


Culture

Baybayin Workshops
Learning Tagalog
Hiphop Workshops
Cultural Dance 

Filipino Martial Art
Safe space for the youth


Struggle
Youth and Students Issues
Human Trafficking
Workers Rights
Know Your Rights Training


Workshops will be run by me, community members and community organizations.Organizations:

that seeks to unite all youth in the struggle for genuine social change 
and liberation of the Philippines. By educating, organizing, and 
mobilizing the youth in Silicon Valley, ABSV fights for the rights of 
Filipinos in America and advances the Philippine struggle for national

story:
Hi! My name is Matt Schober, and along with my partner and longtime friend Ryan Slick, we're here to share our passion for an amazing new concept to make you smarter, stronger, more peaceful, and ultimately happier.

We want to see Indianapolis and surrounding communities able to reach their goals
and become the vibrant, productive, and happy people that they want to be. And through our lifelong interest in nutrition, fitness, and wellness, we've put together the perfect ingredients to help our patrons reach their personal best, whether in creative, intellectual, or athletic pursuits.

I'm skeptical, but intrigued. How do you plan to do that?

We're so glad you asked!


We are launching a truly innovative new business in the heart of our hometown of Indianapolis, and we're truly excited! Better Being will be launching in early 2014; introducing Indiana's only Float Tanks, which provide a level of relaxation and inner exploration not seen anywhere else. In addition to these wonderful devices, we will carry a new style of supplement, blending the best in Western nutritional science with the best in Eastern herbal therapy, along with a couple new twists, culminating in an absolutely unique and incredibly effective line of products. What? You want more? Ok, fine...how about the latest and best in biofeedback technologies, superfoods and whole food extracts that make eating healthy easy and delicious, AND constant improvement as the wellness market continues to innovate?

Excited yet?!?!?!?

But what is a float tank?

Great question!

A float tank (or sensory deprivation tank) contains approximately 8-10 inches of water, with around 800 lbs of pharmaceutical grade salts dissolved in it, allowing a person to become completely buoyant. This leads to complete and total body relaxation, because of the ease of strain on your muscles and even bones, providing pain relief from a vast range of symptoms and lowering blood pressure and stress hormones. In addition, time in the tank post-workout has been proven to lower lactic acid in the blood and muscles, improving recovery and getting you back in the game faster. And it's not just physical – your brain enjoys the downtime as well, as thousands of documented and amazing personal experiences will show. It has also been shown to improve learning abilities and creativity, and enhances meditation tremendously. A well studied body of research that grows daily supports the numerous mental and physical benefits of the tank.

Sounds cool...what's it like in there?

 Once the lid is closed the tank is light- and sound-proof, but don't worry – even claustrophobic people have used the tank and enjoyed it thoroughly once getting over an initial hesitation. In fact, the dark, quiet environment is the perfect compliment to the skin-temperature water, and the combined experience of “letting go” has compelled a wide array of people across the world into making it a part of their routine.

So if this is such a great idea, why have I never heard of it before?

Because we're just now opening!

Seriously though, floating has been around for quite some time. Initially developed by Dr John C Lily in 1954, the idea gained some steam in it's early years but was halted
in the 80's when the public began to (very mistakenly) believe that AIDS could be transmitted through water. Swimming pools took a hit and the fledgling Float industry bottomed out, despite the fact that sanitation has never been an issue due to well established cleaning procedures.

But, in the last 10 years or so, it's made quite a comeback, and around 2010 experienced the biggest boom in the industry yet. This is due in part to the Flotation Tank Association, and to celebrity floaters like Joe Rogan and Robin Williams,  but most of all to the rapidly growing and incredibly enthusiastic community of floaters!

Alright, alright, you sold me on the tank. But what about these new supplements, and biofeedback? I'm hard to convince you know.

Perfect! We want our clients as informed as possible. Providing education and resources for nutrition, fitness, and well-being is our primary goal.

We have partnered with Onnit, a company specializing in Nootropics (brain vitamins), superfoods, and holistic supplementation. This is what sets us apart from any vitamin store you've seen before – we won't be featuring endless rows of bottles and bottles for you to fill your house (and empty your wallet) with. We believe the best and most effective ingredients should be mixed together, in the most efficient way possible, to create an effect within each product truly greater than the sum of it's parts. And all of products are 100% organic and GMO-free. If you'd like to learn more, check them out at www.onnit.com!

As for biofeedback, this simply means technologies that allow us to read variables such as heart rate and realistically gauge the effects that stress, Floating, and our products can have on you. We're working with HeartMath, who have developed a series of programs and games  that train your mind to reduce stress and improve mental performance.

That's awesome!

I know!

Who will benefit the most from a store like this?

We want to be as accessible as possible to everyone. From the weekend warrior to the seasoned athlete, from the busy CEO to the just-as-busy stay at home parent, we have something for everyone to both improve your game and enjoy your downtime.

In addition, much of what we do revolves around reducing stress to allow the body's own natural healing to take place. This will in turn create a more peaceful atmosphere in our hometown, and encourage an exponential spiral of growth and positivity. You can be a valuable part of bringing Floating and all the benefits that come with it to Indy!

Where is your project at, and what exactly will my hard-earned dollars be
going towards?

We are well into development, have approval from the Health Department of Indiana, and are in negotiations for the lease. We've put a lot of time and money into this project so far, developing mentor and business partnerships, paying startup legal fees and business expenses, trying out many different top supplements to find the best, and the Float Tanks aren't cheap to purchase or ship. In addition we will need to add showers and a utility sink to the facility, repaint, add special flooring, purchase initial inventory and tank salt, and much more. The payoff in wealth and health is worth it though, and we're ready to invest everything we can and extend our credit, but we want to make Better Being exactly how we see it in our minds and not have to compromise our vision to make Indiana happier and healthier. So we're reaching out to our future customers to aid with some of the startup costs, giving an already excited community the chance to be an integral part of introducing Floating to Indy!

Our initial asking goal of $20,000, or anything we receive up to and beyond that point, will be used to help with:

-Purchasing and Installing Initial Tanks ($11,000 apiece with shipping)
-Small remodeling budget ($5-6000; we'll be doing a lot of the work ourselves)
-Stocking Initial Inventory ($8-10000)
-Purchase Tank Salt, cleaning, and maintenance supplies ($2000)
-Holding a Launch Party at the store and radio advertising ($2000)

As you can see, we've got our work cut out for us, but we're excited and ready for the challenge!
If we exceed our goal, we would be eternally grateful and it would enable us to:

-Increase the number of initial Float Tanks
-Stock larger initial inventory
-Make Better Being bigger and better for the people of Indianapolis


So we've set two additional stretch goals as well.

At $40,000, we will use the money to purchase a third tank and additional remodeling.
At $60,000, this will show the strong market demand we're expecting and we will open with FOUR tanks!

So what can I do to get this place open, like, today?!?!?

All of our perk donation options are listed to the right, and feel free to contact us with any questions. We will also gladly accept any amount you wish to contribute, if you'd like to see your money go straight to the project instead of a perk. If you love our idea but can't afford to help financially right now, you can still be a big help by sharing our campaign on Facebook and Twitter using the provided links at the top of the page, and by getting the word out about Floating and our unique vision to family and friends!

Either way, we sincerely thank you for your time to this point, and hope to meet you all at Better Being soon!


For more info on our products and services, please visit:

www.betterbeingindy.com

story:
Summary


Todd Villani Todd is an eclectic chef that expertly blends ingredients and flavors from all over the world into a unique menu.Working in someof Manhattan’s top restaurants, including Marcus Samuelsson renowned Aquavit restaurant and at Samuelsson’s subsidiary interest, World Yacht, he has been able to combine culinary techniques and unique flavors into his cuisine. His culinary creativity is backed by solid management experience. He’s had experiencetraining, scheduling and managing kitchen staff, creating seasonal menus, supervising assistant chefs and kitchen staff,implementing software, as well as overall food management, including inventory, ordering, cost control,and purchasing food.  While Todd has worked for some of the most exciting restaurants in the area, he has maintained his own consulting business, creating menus for new Terre à Terre and providing catering and private chef services.

Consumers have become increasingly interested in knowing where their food comes from, which is why the coming year will bring an added emphasis to a different kind of food celebrity — the farmer. During the last few years we saw sales flourish among grocery retailers who jumped on the movement among consumers to “buy local.” In this age of transparency, interest in the farm-to-fork journey has grown considerably, inspired in part by food safety scares and more importantly a desire to know how the food we are serving our families is being produced.


Summary

By all counts the food service industry is a difficult one. The last few years has brought higher food prices at unprecedented levels, crops and livestock destroyed by global weather catastrophes, nations at war over the lack of food supplies, and more food recalls from unique points of origin.

But just as food prices escalate and consumers are faced with fewer and fewer food choices, there is a new realization that locally produced foods provide an opportunity to better control food choices.  Simultaneously, local food producers are finding a wonderful opportunity to supply a new niche market:  the locavore – that is, a person interested in eating food that is locally produced, not moved long distances to market.  And yesterday’s gourmand has multiplied into factions of foodies – people with a passion for cooking, dining out and eating.

There is a certain sense that the “local farmer/producer” is disconnected from the community due to the strong influence of the conventional economy.  The social and cultural divide that keeps food producers and consumers at arm’s length can in some way contribute to the fact that consumers believe they lack control over their choice in product and source. “Consumers want a connection. They want to know the farmers, and they want to know the person that made their food. […] This connection is filling a void.” (Stephani-Ruff, 2005)

In another qualitative study by the Hartman Group, a regional consulting firm, the term “local” is less about closeness to home, but instead it is a “story about a farmer that brings the experience to them. There is a meaning and connection to the farmer.  Consumers know where it came from because it is authentic or straightforward.”  (Hartman Group, 2005)

Many consumer focus groups have found that farmers’ markets and locally owned restaurants are a primary source of “community-building” (Food Policy Council Brief, 2005). “[The history of local foods] connect neighbors of all ages to both the heritage of food and the future of sustainable agriculture.” (Ibid, 2005)

In fact, according to a recent market study by JWT, the environmental impact of food choices will become a more prominent concern as stakeholders – brands, governments, and activist organizations – drive awareness around the issue and rethink what kind of food is sold and how it’s made.  As more regions grapple with food shortages and/or spiking costs, smarter practices around food will join the stable of green “best practices”. 

Markets are not the only ones catering to new market demands.  Many restaurants are becoming more sustainable by revamping their practices and the types of foods they serve.  In the US, there are several restaurant associations dedicated to helping restaurants make the transition. The Magnitude of what the contributor has for this project will benefit many people.

I need 10,000 to 20,000 to begin my journey. To have great food and have friends enjoy it. If i Dont reach the entire goal It will be a blessing no matter what , and every penny will still go to the business so i can produce the best product i can.I understand everyone cant contribute but all I ask is if you can tell another person about my project or share this they might want to conspire to help me.


What your money will go towards:

  • Equipment: commercial dehydrators, commercial food processors, high speed blenders, refrigeration, counter tops, sinks, immersion heaters, dishwasher, etc
  • Building the space: materials, plumbing, electricity, permits, getting everything to health code
  • Other essential stuff: tables, chairs, dishes, etc

 

 

 


<!--[if gte mso 9]> <

Many consumer focus groups have found that farmers’ markets and locally owned restaurants are a primary source of “community-building” (Food Policy Council Brief, 2005). “[The history of local foods] connect neighbors of all ages to both the heritage of food and the future of sustainable agriculture.” (Ibid, 2005)
In fact, according to a recent market study by JWT, the environmental impact of food choices will become a more prominent concern as stakeholders – brands, governments, and activist organizations – drive awareness around the issue and rethink what kind of food is sold and how it’s made.  As more regions grapple with food shortages and/or spiking costs, smarter practices around food will join the stable of green “best practices”.  
Markets are not the only ones catering to new market demands.  Many restaurants are becoming more sustainable by revamping their practices and the types of foods they serve.  In the US, there are several restaurant associations dedicated to helping restaurants make the transition. The Magnitude of what the contributor has for this project will benefit many people.
I need 10,000 to 20,000 to begin my journey. To have great food and have friends enjoy it. If i Dont reach the entire goal It will be a blessing no matter what , and every penny will still go to the business so i can produce the best product i can.I understand everyone cant contribute but all I ask is if you can tell another person about my project or share this they might want to conspire to help me. 

What your money will go towards:

Equipment: commercial dehydrators, commercial food processors, high speed blenders, refrigeration, counter tops, sinks, immersion heaters, dishwasher, etc
Building the space: materials, plumbing, electricity, permits, getting everything to health code
Other essential stuff: tables, chairs, dishes, etc

story:
Our Intentions

The Unis'tot'en Action camp is perhaps the most important environmental direct action campaign currently in progress against the expanding fossil fuel industry in British Columbia.  Although this mass export development seems imminent in the near future, it is crucial that we take the time to focus on building responsible support networks between indiginous and settler communities.  

We plan to organize this Teach-In responsibly with an appropriate anti colonial mindset to enable allyship and trust with the Wet’suwet’en nation.

 

The Teach-In

We will try to provide a space for the leaders of the Unis'tot'en clan to build relationships with the local first nations and grass roots settler organizers around Victoria and Vancouver.  Through our organizing processes and throughout the duration of the teach-in, we will recognize the sovereignty of the local first nations, acting respectfully with their influence in mind.  Our hope is to provide a comfortable space for organizations and nations to meet and strengthen our relationships with trust and understanding, sharing our cultures and intentions.  Ultimately we believe this is a critical strategic moment to strengthen support networks for the Wet’suwet’en nation, which undoubtably neccesitates our ability to communicate and work together effectively.
 

Grassroots Support

We are entirely volunteer run, and  are seeking out many individuals within our community to support us in this work.  We need to cover expenses such as venue fees, food for participants, and our travel budget for First Nations leaders joining us from the front line-
 
We would greatly appreciate your support by making a donation and sharing this campagin.  We hope to use this opportunity to increase momemntum and empowerment within our own communities, as well as to stengthen relationships between indiginous, settler, and front line communities.

story:
My name is Telisha Ng, I’m the creator & producer of the Battle of The Sexes Show and Relationship Coach/Writer at Goddess Intellect.

Battle of the Sexes Show is a distinctive yet interactive social event for patrons to network and participate in lively discussions surrounding the topics of love, marriage, sexuality, dating, and relationships.

Our History

In 2011 after hosting several episodes of my blogtalk radio show called “Menage A Talks” I decided that “sexy and intellectual” conversion should not only be restricted to online radio. I had a strong desire to bring young urban professional men and women together to defy stereotypes and learn more about each other in a fun, non-judgmental way.

Our first show was in September of 2011 in New York City, I hosted and our panel consisted of Lincoln Anthony Blades, Angielala & Slim Jackson. I knew very little about planning events let alone one in another city. I lost a lot of money and had some chaotic moments but it was a success based on the fact that everyone who attended had an amazing time.

Little did I know that this leap of faith would lead to two successful shows in my hometown of Toronto accompanied by demand from audiences internationally to bring Battle of The Sexes to their cities.

Our Mission

In 2013 we set out to bring Battle of The Sexes Show from Toronto to FIVE US cities: Oakland, Atlanta, Washington D.C, New York City and Los Angeles.

Up until this moment I've backed this project with every penny that I've earned. I have the moral support of my panel members, vendors and loved ones however financing a 5-city tour is a task that takes more than just the contents of my flimsy wallet to accomplish.

Our Purpose

My dream is much bigger than me, since the show’s birth in 2011 many small businesses have had an outlet to promote their products and services. Our panelists have gone on to receive more speaking opportunities, win awards and publish their own books.

Most importantly our guests have raved about the quality men and women who attend the events (aka eye candy) ;)

We must be doing something right

Please help us raise $10,000 to jump start the 2013 Battle of The Sexes Tour. The more money we raise the more cities we can bring Battle of The Sexes to in 2013. An average of $2000 will go towards the budget of each city’s show.

Let's keep sexy & intellectual conversation alive & create more opportunities for folks who have wonderful businesses and talents the world has yet to see.

Your donation will go to partially fund (I'm also still financially backing my baby) the following areas

  • Travel & Accommodation
  • Audio Visual rentals
  • Venue Rentals
  • Marketing/Promotions
  • Videographer and Editing

Awesome Perks:

  • Social Media Shoutouts
  • Free tickets to an upcoming show
  • Reserved Seating
  • E-books
  • DVDs from past shows
  • Copy of our exclusive Behind The Battle 2013 Tour DVD
  • 5 City Advertising For your Business

Other Ways You Can Help

You've got bills of your own to pay, I can respect that. If you are unable to donate money please help us reach our goal by doing one of the following:

  • Share this link on Twitter, Facebook, Google+
  • Attend one of the upcoming shows
  • Tell your friends about Battle of The Sexes

Wardrobe sponsorship opportunities available for host & panelist email telisha2@sympatico.ca to inquire.

story:
Short Summary

We are looking to do something different this year.  Instead of holding a traditional Birthday Ball, we are seeking to raise funds to take as many Marine Corps Veterans out on a fishing trip as we can (with no cost to them). 
This trip will be held in recognition of the Marine Corps Birthday and Veteran's Day.  The Corps will be a young 239 years old on November 10, and Veterans Day, Nov. 11, is of course a celebration to honor America's veterans for their patriotism, love of country, and willingness to serve and sacrifice for the common good.
Some of these Veterans are wounded warriors.  We also run an annual bass fishing tournament for severely wounded warriors each Armed Forces Day.  Our 7th annual event will be held May 16, 2015 and will feature more than 30 warriors, mostly single and double amputees.  More information at woundedmarinefishing.com

What We Need & What You Get

The overall cost to rent the boat with gear included is $1500 for 15 Veterans.  It will be $65 for each Veteran thereafter.  We are looking to raise as much as we can to bring as many Veterans as we can possibly give back to.

We are also looking to provide each Veteran with breakfast and lunch.

The Impact

What better way to actually say "thank you" to a Veteran on Veteran's Day than to provide them with something that is rewarding and also peaceful and relaxing.  Both fishing and spending time out on the water have been proven to be very therapeutic activities.  Your donation will help give these heroes a day to remember.

story:
KASHMIR FLOODS SEPTEMBER 2014

Kashmir is facing the worst natures  tragedy in 60 years. Indian-administered Kashmir has been dealing with the biggest and most ferocious floods in a century. With nearly 258 people dead and 600,000 thousand stranded, a sizzling summer turned into a disaster overnight. 

Two weeks later, the crisis has not abated, and already the cost of the damage is estimated at close to $1 billion. Authorities admit they are overwhelmed. But India has shockingly not allowed any direct aid or assistance offered by major international disaster relief agencies, including the United Nations. 

Strangers have tied floating corpses to trees in a bid to render a final dignity. Hospitals have been rendered dysfunctional, forcing pregnant women to deliver on the street. There is a shortage of lifesaving medicines, clean water and supplies. The specter of disease looms large on all waddling knee deep through the flooded streets.

Communication has yet to be fully restored, making relief efforts inordinately difficult on the ground. For a people used to confronting heartache in a two-decade-long insurgency that has cost more than 70,000 lives, this is a trauma of different type: People are desperately awaiting news of loved ones who are still trapped. 

  • Help us with donations, So that we can help our people with food supplies, medicine and warm clothes as winter is just a few months away.
  • For you a few $$ doesn't matter so much but it can make a great difference to our lives  in this devastating time,
If you prefer to donate food, clothing or medicines instead, please email naseer.khanday@gmail.com and we will guide you to the nearest collection point.

Small Contributions will make a big difference!!

  • The more donations we get the more people we will be able to help.
  • Whatever amount we will raise on this campaign will be distributed among the victims in form of food, medicines, and warm clothes.  
  • Your small contributions will make a big difference to the people in need.
We believe that we can help hundreds of people by being a bridge, With this online platform we are sure we will get support from all corners of world and everyone will help us to overcome this tragic time.

From these links you can see the real situation as of now in Kashmir

http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/worldviews/wp/2014/09/08/kashmirs-epic-floods-link-india-and-pakistan-in-disaster/
http://mashable.com/2014/09/08/floods-kashmir/
http://www.hngn.com/articles/41694/20140908/deadly-kashmir-floods-kill-hundreds-pakistani-indian-troops-make-rescue.htm
http://www.cnn.com/2014/09/08/world/asia/india-...
http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/inpictures/2014/09/india-kashmir-pakistan-floods-201498105020420253.html

People who can't contribute please spread the word and help us to raise the funds. Your contributions will be greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

We are 7 & 9 years old and want to go to Washington DC( with our Mommy & Auntie) to learn about our country and see amazing things. We will also represent our town at the 100th year celebration of girl scouts. 

 

     This is a trip we will remember forever! A hands on learning experience where we will be imersed in culture & history. The first time we will be out of New England! We will be going for a long week-end. We will be travelling from Massachusetts. This fund raiser will help pay for our travel expenses. Our landlord gave us notice unexpectedly and our moving costs are threatening our trip that we were already planning. Please help

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let people know about us!

story:
Our Story

Hi, my name is Malcolm Perry, CEO and Founder of Koevelooshen Inc.  Koevelooshen is a company with a single mission of creating more positive black families.  According to a 2010 study, for the first time in US history the majority of American women of marrying age are single.  Among black women the numbers are more dramatic at 70% with 42% of them never being married.  With families being the cornerstone of any culture or community, you can see why our mission is so important.  We will accomplish our mission through our online relationship site that is solely focused on providing single black professionals a safe, secure and private online environment to meet, date and eventually mate.


The Impact

The online dating scene is full of distrust. We have pioneered a new method by conducting background checks and in-person interviews on all prospective members prior to offering membership.  We want to ensure our members that everyone you meet on Koevelooshen has been pre-screened and is looking for a deep committed relationship.


At Koevelooshen, we realize that it is not enough for a company to just put single black professionals who are looking for deep committed relationship in the same space, so we have created a section our website where people can increase their relationship intelligence through a series of articles, instructional videos, etc.  We know everyone regardless of their relationship status can improve their communication and knowledge base.


Finally, we are not only concentrating on the black families of today, we are committed to the future black men and women who will form those strong black families in the future by taking 10% of all revenue generated annually and providing scholarships to black students entering college in the coming academic year.


What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to continue to market and grow are business from city to city because in every city there is a need for our service to connect single black professionals looking for that deep committed relationship.  Currently, we plan to launch in Nashville, Birmingham and Dallas in May 2011.  As we grow from city to city, we plan to hire more City Leaders to promote and market our services and this requires capital.  We believe there is more than enough people who will find our company inspiring and uplifting enough to help fund our cause.  We are for-profit company with a mission that transcends money (creating more positive black families), the family is the foundation of a thriving culture and community.


Please donate today and check out our website www.koevelooshen.com.  All perks will be sent at the end of the campaign.


If you want to learn more about becoming an equity owner in Koevelooshen Inc., please contact us at business@koevelooshen.com.


Other Ways You Can Help

Pass the word about Koevelooshen to help us reach our goal.  You can find us on our website at www.koevelooshen.com, on Facebook, Twitter and our soon to come UStream channel.  You can also join our email list at info@koevelooshen.com.

story:
Everyone Deserves a Christmas.

Why I'm doing this:

As a child, one of the most magical things in life is Christmas. Many of us have fond memories of getting that special present, wrapped with ribbons as the smells of Christmas dinner tickle our senses. All our needs are met, we have clothes that fit and hot running water. Now imagine for a moment that you're a child who doesn't have all that. It's not your fault things are this way, and it seems that Santa forgot you existed. It must be your fault, you weren't good enough, right?

My name is Kirsten Young, I am 24 years old. I grew up in the poor part of town, in the oldest, most decaying house on the block with my mother and sister. My mother was self employed, didn't make much money, and I can remember we had a christmas tree once. I was well aware Santa did not exist many years before the kids in my school caught on, because if he did exist he must have lost my address!

I attended an expensive school on full scholarships, and watched as everyone I knew came back from the Christmas breaks with all their new clothes, talking about all their cool new toys. This was not something my mother could afford, and I was often bullied as a result.

***Update: I have been reminded that I was not on full scolarships at this school, my mother worked extra hard to afford me this education, paying off loans every year as the other school systems wouldn't nurture my learning capabilities in the same way. Later in my life I earned enough scholarships to cover the cost of college, which is where I got mixed up. Sorry! My mother deserves credit here as it was very expensive for her.***

To my mother's relief, some of the local parishes in our community offered a Christmas sponsorship program that did its best to help out impoverished families during the Christmas season. As my school was connected to these parishes, they knew we were a needy family and offered us a chance to participate. Thanks to their kindness, my sister and I were able to get a few presents; things we would never have had otherwise. Nice clothes, nice books, nice toys, and a full turkey dinner!

As the years progressed, I had the chance to participate in the gift-giving side instead of the receiving side, as each class in our school sponsored a different family every year. We had a list of the ages and genders of the children, the age and gender of the parent(s), lists of what they needed and wanted, and so raised money to buy the gifts accordingly. I used to stay after school to finish wrapping all the rest of the gifts after we'd gone shopping for them, as it meant so much to me to be able to pay forward the kindness.

When Christmas doesn't come to a child's house, they take it personally. Instead of a heart full of joy and excitement, these children experience depression and sadness. The parents may experience guilt, shame, and more depression.

With your help, we can bring Christmas to at least some of those families, and make a real impact on their lives with this random act of kindness. We can meet some of their most desperate needs, and give them something to smile about. Let's spread some cheer!

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for as much funding as I can get. Every penny will be spent on sponsoring families for whom Christmas seems like a distant dream. The more money that is raised, the more families we can bless. If I have to start this year by only blessing one family, then that is what I will do. But I have hope that we can bless many, many more.

A $20 donation means skipping out on 4 lattes, or two meals at a restaurant, or one pizza. In return you can be pleased with yourself that you've helped to feed and clothe children this Christmas!

In my day job I am not only a housewife but also a papercrafter (www.facebook.com/TheScrapDragon), so I am offering packs of 4 exclusive handmade Christmas Cards for anyone who donates $20, and packs of 10 exclusive handmade Christmas Cards for anyone who donates $40. For a donation of $100 or more, I will personally make for you all the cards you need for a year! (When claiming these perks please use the tools to the right that say "claim this perk" or I won't know if you want it!)

If the goal of $1000 is not reached, I will use whatever has been raised for the exact same purpose, only a smaller number of children will be reached. And no matter what happens this year, I will continue this project every year that I am able.

The Impact

I am on a mission to recreate for other children the feelings of gratitude I had as a child for the wonderful people who helped to make my life feel normal for that one day of the year. I want my two sons to experience this kind of giving and remember this for the rest of their lives so they might pass on the tradition. Over time, we can potentially reach hundreds (if not thousands) of children and give them lasting memories of fun, joy, and peace.

The lives of the people we can help will be affected in a very positive way. This may renew their faith in humanity, or at least take some pressure off what is supposed to be a joyful occasion.

I have been involved in every step of this kind of program over the years, all the way from the application forms, organisation and distribution, to the receiving end. I am in touch with family support workers who know which families could use the most help, which will help me put this money where it can be most useful. I'm not here to help myself or my friends, but to help people (mainly children) understand what joy feels like in hopes it will bring more joy into their lives as a result.

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary donations are very graciously accepted, but if you can't make a donation, why not take a second and share this campaign with your friends via whatever form of social media you're into? Someone might see and be more than willing to donate.

Indiegogo has provided some tools here that make sharing easy!

If you're a journalist, feel free to write an article about my cause! I can be contacted on the facebook page address listed above.

However you choose to help (even if all you do is share this), you will be making a huge impact on people's lives! Even a small amount of money can buy socks, a shirt, or pair of jeans. To a needy child, that's a big deal. To a struggling parent, that means the world.

Thank You, Thank You, Thank You for your time and contributions!
story_txt:
Everyone Deserves a Christmas.
Why I'm doing this:
As a child, one of the most magical things in life is Christmas. Many of us have fond memories of getting that special present, wrapped with ribbons as the smells of Christmas dinner tickle our senses. All our needs are met, we have clothes that fit and hot running water. Now imagine for a moment that you're a child who doesn't have all that. It's not your fault things are this way, and it seems that Santa forgot you existed. It must be your fault, you weren't good enough, right?
My name is Kirsten Young, I am 24 years old. I grew up in the poor part of town, in the oldest, most decaying house on the block with my mother and sister. My mother was self employed, didn't make much money, and I can remember we had a christmas tree once. I was well aware Santa did not exist many years before the kids in my school caught on, because if he did exist he must have lost my address!
I attended an expensive school on full scholarships, and watched as everyone I knew came back from the Christmas breaks with all their new clothes, talking about all their cool new toys. This was not something my mother could afford, and I was often bullied as a result.
***Update: I have been reminded that I was not on full scolarships at this school, my mother worked extra hard to afford me this education, paying off loans every year as the other school systems wouldn't nurture my learning capabilities in the same way. Later in my life I earned enough scholarships to cover the cost of college, which is where I got mixed up. Sorry! My mother deserves credit here as it was very expensive for her.***
To my mother's relief, some of the local parishes in our community offered a Christmas sponsorship program that did its best to help out impoverished families during the Christmas season. As my school was connected to these parishes, they knew we were a needy family and offered us a chance to participate. Thanks to their kindness, my sister and I were able to get a few presents; things we would never have had otherwise. Nice clothes, nice books, nice toys, and a full turkey dinner!
As the years progressed, I had the chance to participate in the gift-giving side instead of the receiving side, as each class in our school sponsored a different family every year. We had a list of the ages and genders of the children, the age and gender of the parent(s), lists of what they needed and wanted, and so raised money to buy the gifts accordingly. I used to stay after school to finish wrapping all the rest of the gifts after we'd gone shopping for them, as it meant so much to me to be able to pay forward the kindness.
When Christmas doesn't come to a child's house, they take it personally. Instead of a heart full of joy and excitement, these children experience depression and sadness. The parents may experience guilt, shame, and more depression.
With your help, we can bring Christmas to at least some of those families, and make a real impact on their lives with this random act of kindness. We can meet some of their most desperate needs, and give them something to smile about. Let's spread some cheer!


What We Need & What You Get
I'm asking for as much funding as I can get. Every penny will be spent on sponsoring families for whom Christmas seems like a distant dream. The more money that is raised, the more families we can bless. If I have to start this year by only blessing one family, then that is what I will do. But I have hope that we can bless many, many more.
A $20 donation means skipping out on 4 lattes, or two meals at a restaurant, or one pizza. In return you can be pleased with yourself that you've helped to feed and clothe children this Christmas!
In my day job I am not only a housewife but also a papercrafter (www.facebook.com/TheScrapDragon), so I am offering packs of 4 exclusive handmade Christmas Cards for anyone who donates $20, and packs of 10 exclusive handmade Christmas Cards for anyone who donates $40. For a donation of $100 or more, I will personally make for you all the cards you need for a year! (When claiming these perks please use the tools to the right that say "claim this perk" or I won't know if you want it!)
If the goal of $1000 is not reached, I will use whatever has been raised for the exact same purpose, only a smaller number of children will be reached. And no matter what happens this year, I will continue this project every year that I am able.


The Impact
I am on a mission to recreate for other children the feelings of gratitude I had as a child for the wonderful people who helped to make my life feel normal for that one day of the year. I want my two sons to experience this kind of giving and remember this for the rest of their lives so they might pass on the tradition. Over time, we can potentially reach hundreds (if not thousands) of children and give them lasting memories of fun, joy, and peace.
The lives of the people we can help will be affected in a very positive way. This may renew their faith in humanity, or at least take some pressure off what is supposed to be a joyful occasion.
I have been involved in every step of this kind of program over the years, all the way from the application forms, organisation and distribution, to the receiving end. I am in touch with family support workers who know which families could use the most help, which will help me put this money where it can be most useful. I'm not here to help myself or my friends, but to help people (mainly children) understand what joy feels like in hopes it will bring more joy into their lives as a result.


Other Ways You Can Help
Monetary donations are very graciously accepted, but if you can't make a donation, why not take a second and share this campaign with your friends via whatever form of social media you're into? Someone might see and be more than willing to donate.
Indiegogo has provided some tools here that make sharing easy!
If you're a journalist, feel free to write an article about my cause! I can be contacted on the facebook page address listed above.
However you choose to help (even if all you do is share this), you will be making a huge impact on people's lives! Even a small amount of money can buy socks, a shirt, or pair of jeans. To a needy child, that's a big deal. To a struggling parent, that means the world.
Thank You, Thank You, Thank You for your time and contributions!

story:
UPDATE: To see Dr. Bob's interview on the news click the link below

http://www.kspr.com/videobeta/?watchId=c1bdd96d...

About Nathan P. Murphy's and The Blues Clinic

Nathan P. Murphy's

When Nathan P. Murphy's first opened its door 30 years ago, owner and founder Bob Martin defied the odds and chose downtown Springfield, MO to be the home to best in jazz and blues. The club's first national touring act was none other than Buddy Rich.  He has since showcased the likes of the Tommy Dorsey Orchestra, Count Basie's Orchestra, the late Maynard Ferguson, The Fabulous Thunderbirds, John Mayall, Tommy Castro and Joe Bonamassa...just to mention a few.

Nathan P. Murphy's has remained the anchor for downtown Springfield as the town continues to grow and continue to sprout up in the area. 


The Blues Clinic

Seventeen years ago Bob Martin was invited as a guest to share his expertise of artists and musicians with radio listeners.. and has been on air ever since. Springfield was quick to recognize Bob's knowledge and love of music in combination with his genuine love of his town and its residents. Bob, better known as Dr. Bob, has answered to record breaking ratings year after year.

Our Story-What Happened

Nearly five years ago Dr. Bob was diagnosed with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease C.O.P.D. Dr. Bob is a non smoker. The cause was exposure to second hand smoke.  The national acts the club was once famous for came to a halt as Dr. Bob privately focused on his health. He nearly lost his life. Dr. Bob now only has 53% of his lung capacity. Consequently, Murphy's became the first smoke free venue in downtown Springfield and as he healed, Dr. Bob resumed booking talented artists and musicians.  As Dr. Bob and his club were making a comeback, the economy fell to despair. As a result, the club was hit with another devastating blow. As most of America struggled to recover from this recession, very few indulged arts and entertainment.  

As the club continued to suffer, Dr. Bob's radio program continued to grow in the ratings. It was obvious that Springfield, MO had the Blues. What most of Dr. Bob's listeners don't realize is that Dr. Bob's position at the Blues Clinic is a labor of love...in other words...an unpaid position. For 17 years on air Dr. Bob has dedicated his shows to his love of music and his fans.

What all of this means to Dr. Bob, Nathan P. Murphy's and You

With nothing coming in from his time on air and the staggering decline in patrons to the club, Dr. Bob and his Blues Clinic aka Nathan P. Murphy's have become the latest victims in this perilous economy and are now facing foreclosure.

If foreclosed upon Bob Martin will lose his home, Dr. Bob will lose his Blue Clinic, his fans will lose their Sunday morning shot of the Blues, and Springfield will lose 30 years of history.

What We Need & What You Get

From it all, we are at the crossroads, trying to save the Blues Clinic and Nathan P. Murphy's from forclosure. We need to raise $62,000 fast--and we need your help. 

In sincere gratitude for your support of the Blues Show and Nathan P. Murphy's 30 year history, Dr. Bob has put together some great "perks" to express his thanks.

"A sincerest Thank You for all of your love and support"~ Dr. Bob

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help get the word out by sharing this plea with your friends and loved ones. Tweet, FaceBook, Myspace and all those other social networks are a wonderful way to connect our community. Together, we can save Murphy's.

story:
WHAT IS ONGIEMARIES?

My name is Ongelique Sherman and I am a young entrepreneur with dreams of getting my business off the ground.  I am a "green" purse designer and the name of my business is "Ongiemaries".  I create one-of-a-kind purses using canvas bags, recycled magazines and newspapers.  I add vibrant fabrics, ribbons, buttons, zippers, and stylish handles to each bag to make them unique.  Each bag is handmade and personalized to a customer's taste.  Some customers may want a bag with pictures of their family or friends, a workout bag, a grocery bag, or even a bag to carry their books in for school.  NO TWO PRODUCTS ARE EVER ALIKE!  Other products I make are clutches, make-up bags, laptop bags, bracelets, messenger bags and wallets for men and women.  These bags are great gift ideas for the following special occassions:
  • Birthday Gifts
  • Graduation Presents
  • Back to School Bookbags
  • Probate Season (all greeks are included)
  • Mother's/Father's Day
  • Christmas Gifts
  • Valentine's Day
  • Anniversaries
  • Bridesmaids Gifts
  • and many more!

Check out my website: www.ongiemaries.ws

 

               

 

            MY STORY: How I started ONGIEMARIES

When I was nine years old, I was diagnosed with Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma which is a type of blood cancer.  I was on chemotherapy for a year and since  January 2002 I have been 11 years in remission!  While in middle and high school I attended a kids cancer camp, called Camp Sunshine, and one of the activities was purse making.  That is where I learned my craft of making purses.  I learned how to apply images of my choice to a plain canvas bag.  The first time I carried one of my purses to school, my friends, teachers and the school administrators loved it and asked if I could make them a bag!  I never knew that a simple craft would attract so much attention from my peers.  Today I've been making purses since 2008 and I am ready to go to the next level with my bags.  Over the years, the designs of my purses have evolved tremendously and they are still growing as I try to keep up with current styles and trends while infusing my own fashion prespective to each bag.  Through this life experience of having cancer, this craft has influenced me to give 5% of each sale to the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society to further their ability to find a cure for cancer.

WHERE DO YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS GO?

Your donations will allow me to buy supplies needed to make my one-of-a-kind bags and will allow me to begin to increase the production of my bags.  Most importantly, the more bags I am able to produce, the more money I will be able to donated to The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, the organization that truly blessed me, my family and others who's lives have been touched by cancer. 
 
 

FUTURE GOALS!

My short term goal is to raise enough money so I can create a large number of my products and have them sold in boutiques in my hometown.  I would also like to create enough products so I can showcase them at vendor events as well as at my college.  My long term goal is to eventually have my bags sold in major retail stores near you.  I plan to continue to donate 5% of my sales to The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society and wish to increase that percentage as my brand becomes well known around the world.  I cannot do this without your help!  So please donate towards ONGIEMARIES and help me build my brand as well as helping to find a cure for cancer!

story:
Do con-goers dream of amazing parties?

We do.

From the creative minds that brought you End of Line Club, Milk+Bar, and Open The Door: 
The Merchants of Deva are proud to present Replicant, our take on Blade Runner 

In order to create this one-of-a-kind experience, we will need your help. Your tax-deductible contribution will enable us to rent the suite, pay for food and beverages, and set up the space to impress all of our guests like you've come to expect from us.


If you love the Merchants parties at Norwescon -- or even if you've never heard of us before, but are just interested in having a good time -- then help make this happen. The biggest thrill for us in doing these parties all these years has been getting to watch all of you have a great time, and knowing that we made that happen for you. We want to share that feeling with you -- watching a few hundred of your fellow geeks having a night they'll never forget because of you feels amazing, and we can't wait to show you what that's like.


A Second Party

Last year the donors Friday night party was a lot of fun for everyone. We would really like to do this again. If we reach our stretch goal of $3000 we will again open our suite for an exclusive Friday night gathering. All donors at any level will be able to bring a guest to pick up your perks and get a look at what we have prepared before the doors are opened for the general public on Saturday night. 


***Special: if we meet our second stretch goal of $3500 all MoD members at the party will get a Blade Runner license with their name on it just like Rick Deckard! See our Facebook for proto-type art.***


A brief note for our off-world colonists:

Delivery of all of the donor perks is planned to be on-site at Norwescon. If you are going to be unable to attend Norwescon and would like us to ship your perks to you we ask that you increase your pledge by $10 to cover the costs involved in shipping to US addresses. If you are interested in international shipping please contact us to see what arrangements can be made.

story:
Short Summary

"Finding Beauty in the World Around You" follows the same concept as the Blossomy.org workshop held last year in Kolkata, India.  Teens at the YES Club (an after school safe haven in Newark, OH where 27% of the population lives beneath the poverty line*) will spend five weeks exploring different ways to appreciate and find beauty in even the most unexpected places.  Each class consists of an activity such as photo scavenger hunts, sunprint art created from litter and found object sculptures.  Students will be posed with the question, "Do you see darkness in the world around you or do you choose to search for the light?".  

* statistic from a 2009 study published on www.city-data.com

What We Need 

There will be about 25 teens in the class.  These are the materials I am definitely planning to use in the workshop, but if funding is received in excess, I'll be able to add even more projects:

  • Sunprint paper (5 sheets per student): $116 + shipping
  • Transfer paper (2 sheets per student): $120 + shipping
  • Transfer base (1 tile per student): $164
  • Ink & Paper: anticipated usage $100
  • Additional materials if over-funded: sealer (oil & water-based), foam brushes, spray adhesive, acrylic paints, gel medium, hardware store field trip to pick out materials, etc.

The Impact

A large number of teens, regardless of their socio-economic status, are looking for an escape from the world they currently live in.  The goal is to plant a seed that begins to alter their way of seeing the world around themselves and the parts they play within it.:

  • Encourages participants to see the silver lining in various environments and situations.
  • Empowers them to make choices on how they interpret and interact with their surroundings.
  • Promotes resourcefulness and community service.
  • Nurtures creativity and freedom of expression.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donate your old digital cameras.  The YES Club currently has 10, but I could use up to 15 more and hold onto them for future workshops with other organizations.  These don't have to be of a great quality.  As long as it functions and students can see their images on the back of the camera, it works for us!
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

story:
Help the Burroughs Family

Brandon Burroughs recently lost his mother, Patricia Burroughs, in a tragic traffic incident on Christmas Day.  More information about the incident can be found here: http://www.wate.com/story/24304789/one-person-dead-four-injured-after-head-on-collision-in-mascot. 

Brandon is an avid outdoorsman and dedicated family man. He has spent a great deal of time sharing his wealth of knowledge on outdoor and survival-related topics on Youtube. In addition, he also serves as a moderator on the Tennessee Outdoor Forum. In short--He's an all around great guy and we here at the Tennessee Outdoor Forum want to do what we can to help Brandon and his family during this time of need.

Due to the loss of his mother, his family now faces a major financial hurdle.  In addition to arranging for his mother's final expenses, Brandon must also purchase a vehicle since the vehicle his mother was driving belonged to Brandon and serves as his transportation to-and-from work. 

This IndieGoGo fund is being set up by Brandon's friends at the Tennessee Outdoor Forum in the hope that we can help him somewhat during this difficult time. 

Funds raised via this IndieGoGo fund will go directly to the Brandon and his family to be used as they deem appropriate.


If you can't afford to give, that's fine! Continued thoughts and prayers for Brandon and his family are definitely needed and appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help!

story:
THANKS FOR GIVING US A LOOK!


Short Summary

Curbside Cuisine is the non-profit organization that aims to better the downtown Colorado Springs area by enabling Food Trucks to display and sell their gourmet goodies.  With the help of our community, this project aims to provide an indoor dining area that would provide comfortable seating, a live music venue, a study lounge, and best of all a warm place to hang out with friends and eat your delicious food truck goodies.  Who knows what else this location can provide!? Maybe even a bicycle valet!? Have you ever ate at a food truck? We'll heres your chance!

This garage bay will be open ALL YEAR ROUND for our community to enjoy!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds that we need will go toward building a wall along the entire inside edge of thebuilding that will cover wires and other hazards to keep clients away from inner workings of the bay.

Attached to the wall will be a bar that also stretches along the whole bay to provide maximum seating space.

The remaining funds will go into painting the bay and transforming it into a dining wonderland!

SOME OF OUR DELICIOUS CURBSIDE CUISINE:



THE COMMUNITY AND CURBSIDE MEMBERS


Perks!

  • Perks will include punch cards to allow you to dine at all the trucks for up to 20 days!
  • Another perk we will have is a plaque that will hang inside the renovated dining bay, displaying your name or your company's name for all to see!
  • If our goal isn't reached we will spend the acquired funds on partially renovating the bay and make it as habitable as possible.
  • OR
  • If our goal isn't met we may also get a tent to accommodate for outdoor dining. 
  • The design on the shirt is as follows:

  • Our Customized rubber bracelets will come in a selection of 4 colors: Glow-in-dark green, white and gray, white and teal, and white and pink! So make sure you tell us which one you want!

  • ALL PERKS INCLUDE THE PERK WITH LESSER VALUE, EXCEPT THE ROUNDTRIP TICKET AND THE ROUND TRIP TICKET WITH SHIRT.

The Impact

IF and WHEN our goal is reached, there will be immediate changes taking place.

  • This corner is located across the street from Palmer High School, so the renovated bay will provide an unparalleled dining experience for the students and staff.
  • The bay can serve as an area for the students to do homework (we will provide free wi-fi) while they grab their lunch or dinner!
  • The renovated bay can also function as a mini event area where local musicians can display their skills as well as a possible gallery for local artists to display their work.
  • At this moment, the winter has slowed down business at Curbside Cuisine due to the cold weather and harsh winds.  This corner will allow patrons of Curbside to grab their food and take it inside where they will benefit the plush amenities of FREE Wi-Fi, indoor games, vast seating options, and best of all..WARMTH!
  • During the warmer months, the bay will remain open to provide shade and seating while you devour your food truck meals!
  • The possibilities are ENDLESS!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to lend a hand monetarily, you can still share our page with friends and family and possible investors that can help us make a MAJOR change to Colorado Springs.

And that’s all there is to it.

Some Cool Links!

Curbside Cuisine's website.

Article in the Colorado Springs Independent

Another article in the Colorado Springs Independent

Maybe even a bicycle valet!? Have you ever ate at a food truck? story:
Help us get our big brother back!

Do you miss Matt? We do too! He's living in LA now and is dangerously close to forest fires. He lives in a run-down shack with no electricity or food. His only company are rats. He may have another friend named Matt, but we think he may have made it up. Please, we need our brother - help us bring him home!

"Your eyes shined bright 
When you were a kid 
Your sisters loved you 
And all that you did 
Big brother, big brother 
Don't worry a bit 
Your flame has not faded 
Since the day it was lit"

- The Black Keys

I hope this brought a tear to your eye, we're certainly sobbing over here. Please part with your pennies - it's for a wonderful cause. 

Reunite the Friedmans!

story:
Samuel Jillali, world traveler and third-culture kid, settles in Kenya to build a new entrepreneurial life based on the principles of returning to the soil and how to get closer to the elusive concept of 100% sustainability.

His goal is not just to expand Footprints Farm from fresh vegetables to dairy and honey production, but to create a "get away from it all" lodge and volunteer center for foreigners and residents of the Ugenya community. 

Hear it from the man, himself.... 

 

Hi everyone,

Quick introduction here! My name is Sam and I’m originally from France, although I grew up in many different countries, including India and Kenya, thanks to my parents’ wander lusting ways. More recently, though, I have lived and worked in Europe.

In 2009, I had the crazy notion that leaving everything I knew and starting a farm in Africa would be a good idea. Fast forward three years later and here I am with 15 acres of land and 15 employees in Ugenya, Kenya.

It’s been a wild ride of ups and downs with a few successes and, unfortunately, some massive failures as well.

 

The Farm

For the moment, we have been concentrating on horticulture; growing tomatoes, lettuce, cucumbers, spinach, cabbage, courgette, cauliflower and much more. All of the produce we grow is sold locally, either in restaurants and hotels or in the local market places.

This is an area in Kenya where agriculture has hardly been experimented with before, and most rural villages live mainly off the maize and kale that they are able to grow on their own plots of land. It has certainly been an interesting process as we slowly start introducing new types of vegetables into the market.

Over the past two years since we started vegetable production, we have seen a huge change in the markets. Fresh vegetables are becoming more readily available and local farmers have started experimenting with new crops as well; simply because they have seen that it can be done.

 

    The Dream

Although we have had some success with vegetable production and have been able to find stable markets for most of what we grow, our ultimate dream is to have a completely sustainable farm where locals can come to receive training or just pick up some new ideas for their own farms.

Part of this dream is also to create a lodge near the farm where both Kenyans and foreigners can come and stay for a few days or weeks to get away from their concrete jungle, relax, enjoy nature, and maybe even try their hand at farming.

But big dreams start with smaller ones, so for now we want to focus on bringing Footprints Farm to the point where it is entirely self-sustainable. This will include everything from cows and chickens for milk, eggs and organic fertilizer, to bees for honey and better pollination of crops, to trees for shade and soil conservation.

 

What We Need

We are already moving steadily towards our goal of becoming sustainable, with over 2,000 new trees planted, a steady crop production, a cow shed and chicken house nearly set up, and a good chunk of money set aside for purchasing the cows and chickens.

Unfortunately, we are still short of some of the money we need to get our dairy unit up and functioning properly. It’s a huge undertaking and we’ll need to plant feeds for the cows, set up a refrigeration unit at the farm and hire more staff that is competent with dairy farming.

Two-thousand Euros will help us to tie up all the loose ends and get things to the point where we are actually making good profit so that we can continue to expand on these ideas.

Anything you are able to give will go a very long way to helping us make our dream a reality. And who knows? Maybe in a few years you’ll be spending your vacation with us at the new Footprints Farm Lodge in Kenya…

 

www.footprintsfarmkenya.com

www.footprintsfarmkenya.blogspot.com

 

See the farm on Google Maps: http://goo.gl/maps/kZNb

story:
Short Summary

Sean Kennedy spent his 20 years on earth welcoming anyone who needed help into his home. He was murdered in 2007 for being gay. (His murderer, Stephen Moller, served less than a year.) After his death, his mother found out that all the people he'd invited to sleep in their living room for the night were strangers. But to Sean, they were friends who needed help. No one was a stranger in Sean's eyes. Likewise, this LGBT center will be able to house a few teens for the night and provide local resources for help, in areas like suicide prevention and homelessness due to being LGBT (or for any other reason).

Some of these resources would include suicide prevention and a place to sleep for the night. The LGBT center would also be able to house Gay-Straight Alliance meetings for students who are homeschooled or whose schools don't allow it (which here, is most of them). 

South Carolina desperately needs a place like this. Having lived in Spartanburg all my life, I can vouch for this. We need help for our LGBT youth, who are constantly being bullied or rejected or pushed to the brink of death. As much as we wish teachers or parents would be supportive, they are most often the perpetrators, not saviors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Show people this campaign! Even if you can't spare a dime in this harsh economy, you can STILL help us by sharing on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, StumbleUpon, Google+, Reddit, and more! Never underestimate the power of the computer you're on.

     
  • Go to http://www.Seanslastwish.org to find out more about Sean's Last Wish, Sean, or his mother Elke. You can also send donations to this website through PAYPAL if you prefer.

story:
Short Summary

OpenLayers contributors have been working tirelessly to make the most powerful, flexible web mapping client toolkit for years, and now we need your help. 

The web has advanced, and others are showing all the amazing things possible. To properly take advantage of the next generation of web technologies we believe it is time for OpenLayers to be redone from the ground up.

If OpenLayers has ever helped you in a project then please consider supporting the team now with funding to create the next generation of advances, with WebGL, smaller builds, friendly APIs, and better default design. Join us in building a project that is fully open source and never controlled by any one organization.

What We Need & What You Get

This Indiegogo campaign is part of a larger campaign to raise the full amount needed to take OpenLayers to 3.0. If you or your organization can contribute more than $5000 please get in touch with the OL3 fundraising committee at ol3-funding@googlegroups.com 

Funding will sponsor dedicated project management and developer time of the leading OpenLayers contributors to bring the API to 3.0, as well as a series of dedicated sprints to make significant progress.

We are giving out several 'perks' to contributors, including credits in the OpenLayers release notes, t-shirts, and invitations to the final 3.0 sprint, which will focus on user needs and documentation.

If we don't reach the entire goal then the funds will still go to the development of OpenLayers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute substantial money there are a number of ways you can help:

  • Get the word out about the campaign
  • Convince organizations you work for or know to contribute (see below for more info).
  • Contribute to the software development with javascript coding, and later documentation, design and testing. Join the project lists at http://openlayers.org/mailman/listinfo
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to post on social media.

If you want to help find organizations who can contribute $5k or more then email ol3-funding@googlegroups.com to coordinate. We hope to have an funding prospectus targeted at organizations who might invest in OpenLayers 3.0, offering them some organizational 'perks'. And we can also help coordinate how to approach them.
